original: de yi 'jigs chen gang zhig lags //
analyzed: de yi 'jigs chen gang zhig lags //
translated: What is the great fear of that?

original: ma rig pas ni 'jig rten bsgribs //
analyzed: ma rig pas ni 'jig rten bsgribs //
translated: The world is obscured by ignorance.

original: bag med phyir ni gsal ma yin //
analyzed: bag med phyir ni gsal ma yin //
translated: Because of carelessness, it is not clear.

original: rtog pas bsgos zhes nga smra ste //
analyzed: rtog pas bsgos zhes nga smra ste //
translated: I say it is stained by conceptualization.

original: de yi 'jig rten sdug bsngal yin //🔽rgyun rnams kun nas 'dzag pa yi //
analyzed: de yi 'jig rten sdug bsngal yin // rgyun rnams kun nas 'dzag pa yi //
translated: That is the suffering of the world.🔽What is the reversal of the streams

original: rgyun rnams bzlog pa gang zhig lags //
analyzed: rgyun rnams bzlog pa gang zhig lags //
translated: That flow everywhere?🔽Please teach the restraint of the streams.

original: rgyun rnams sdom pa bka' stsol cig / rgyun ni gang gis dgag par bgyi //
analyzed: rgyun rnams sdom pa bka' stsol cig / rgyun ni gang gis dgag par bgyi //
translated: By what are the streams stopped?

original: 'jig rten rgyun ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyun ni gang yin pa //
translated: The streams of the world

original: de dag @257b bzlog par dran pa ste //
analyzed: de dag @257b bzlog par dran pa ste //
translated: Are remembered as being reversed.🔽If the restraint of the streams

original: rgyun rnams sdom par bshad bya na //
analyzed: rgyun rnams sdom par bshad bya na //
translated: Is explained,

original: shes rab kyis ni dgag par bya //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni dgag par bya //
translated: It is stopped by wisdom.🔽Wisdom, mindfulness, name, and form

original: shes rab dang ni dran pa dang // ming dang gzugs ni rnam kun du //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni dran pa dang // ming dang gzugs ni rnam kun du //
translated: In all aspects

original: de ni gang du 'gag 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de ni gang du 'gag 'gyur ba //
translated: Where is it stopped?

original: zhu na de ni bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: zhu na de ni bdag la gsungs //
translated: If asked, please teach that to me.🔽Wisdom, mindfulness, name, and form

original: shes rab dang ni dran pa dang // ming dang gzugs ni rnam kun du //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni dran pa dang // ming dang gzugs ni rnam kun du //
translated: In all aspects

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags gyur na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags gyur na //
translated: When consciousness ceases,

original: der ni de yang 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni de yang 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: There it also ceases.

original: dran pa spyod pa'i rnam par shes //
analyzed: dran pa spyod pa'i rnam par shes //
translated: The consciousness that engages in mindfulness

original: ji ltar 'jug 'gyur zhu lags na //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug 'gyur zhu lags na //
translated: is asked how it engages.

original: ji bzhin the tshom ma mchis par //
analyzed: ji bzhin the tshom ma mchis par //
translated: Just as it is, without doubt,

original: de ni bdag la bshad du gsol //🔽nang dang phyi yi tshor ba la //
analyzed: de ni bdag la bshad du gsol // nang dang phyi yi tshor ba la //
translated: please explain that to me.🔽When one does not delight

original: mngon par dga' bar mi byed na //🔽de ltar dran pa spyod pa yi //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar mi byed na // de ltar dran pa spyod pa yi //
translated: in inner and outer feelings,🔽in that way the consciousness

original: rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: that engages in mindfulness engages.🔽Those who possess the well-spoken Dharma

original: gang dag legs gsungs chos can dang // gang dag slob pa tha dad pa //
analyzed: gang dag legs gsungs chos can dang // gang dag slob pa tha dad pa //
translated: and those who are different trainees

original: de dag nang nas 'grus pa'i spyod //
analyzed: de dag nang nas 'grus pa'i spyod //
translated: among them, the conduct of the diligent

original: zhu na bzod ldan bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: zhu na bzod ldan bdag la gsungs //
translated: is asked. Please speak to me, the patient one.

original: 'dod pa rnams la chags med cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la chags med cing //
translated: Without attachment to desires

original: yid kyis rnyog pa med par byed //
analyzed: yid kyis rnyog pa med par byed //
translated: and making the mind free from turbidity,🔽skilled in all phenomena

original: chos rnams kun la mkhas pa dang // dran pas dge slong kun du rgyu //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la mkhas pa dang // dran pas dge slong kun du rgyu //
translated: the monk wanders with mindfulness.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol du sgrol ba las ma pham pas zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol du sgrol ba las ma pham pas zhus pa yin no //
translated: This is the question of Ajita in the Parinirvāṇa Sūtra.

original: 'jig rten ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni gsum ste /
translated: The world is threefold:

original: 'dod pa'i 'jig rten dang / gzugs kyi 'jig rten dang / gzugs med pa'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'jig rten dang / gzugs kyi 'jig rten dang / gzugs med pa'i 'jig rten no //
translated: the world of desire, the world of form, and the formless world.

original: don gyi skabs 'di ni rab tu byung ba'i 'jig rten dang / khyim pa'i 'jig rten las dgongs so //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'di ni rab tu byung ba'i 'jig rten dang / khyim pa'i 'jig rten las dgongs so //
translated: The present context refers to the world of the ordained and the world of the householder.

original: de la rab tu byung ba'i 'jig rten la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rab tu byung ba'i 'jig rten la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The world of the ordained is twofold:

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos can rnams so //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos can rnams so //
translated: those who follow a wrongly taught doctrine and those who follow a well-taught doctrine.

original: de la nyes par bshad pa'i chos can gang yin pa de dag ni ma rig pas bsgribs so //
analyzed: de la nyes par bshad pa'i chos can gang yin pa de dag ni ma rig pas bsgribs so //
translated: Those who follow a wrongly taught doctrine are obscured by nescience.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos can gang yin pa de dag ni rig pa'i gsal ba'i skabs yod mod kyi bag med pas mi gsal lo //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos can gang yin pa de dag ni rig pa'i gsal ba'i skabs yod mod kyi bag med pas mi gsal lo //
translated: Those who follow a well-taught doctrine have the opportunity to be illuminated by knowledge, but they are not because of their heedlessness.

original: khyim pa gos dkar po gyon pa tha dad pa rnams ni rtog pas bsgos pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa gos dkar po gyon pa tha dad pa rnams ni rtog pas bsgos pa yin no //
translated: Householders who wear white robes are stained by imagination.

original: rtog pa de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /🔽bsnyad pa'i gzhi gsum po dag la yang rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /🔽bsnyad pa'i gzhi gsum po dag la yang rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That imagination should be understood as threefold:🔽imagination of the unreal, imagination of the unreal in the unreal, and imagination of the unreal in the real.

original: tha snyad bzhi brjod pa la yang rtog pa zhes bya'o //🔽tshig 'byung bar byed pa'i rtog pa la yang @258a * //
analyzed: tha snyad bzhi brjod pa la yang rtog pa zhes bya'o // tshig 'byung bar byed pa'i rtog pa la yang @258a * //
translated: The expression of the four phrases is also called “conceptualization.🔽”

original: rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conceptualization that produces speech is also called “conceptualization.🔽”

original: de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i bsnyad pa'i gzhi rnams las /
analyzed: de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i bsnyad pa'i gzhi rnams las /
translated: Among the bases of designation of the past, future, and present,

original: tha snyad gzhi las brtsams te /
analyzed: tha snyad gzhi las brtsams te /
translated: conceptualization arises from the basis of designation.

original: rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa dag la rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi mthun pa'am mi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa dag la rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi mthun pa'am mi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: Conceptualization is either in agreement or disagreement with the conceptualizations of others.🔽This is called “the function of the gate.

original: de ni de dag gi sgo bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi sgo bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the door of their liberation.

original: de ltar snga ma'i rtog pa dang / phyi ma'i bsgo ba ni phal cher khyim pa rnams la snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma'i rtog pa dang / phyi ma'i bsgo ba ni phal cher khyim pa rnams la snang ste /
translated: In this way, the conceptualization of the past and the function of the gate in the future are mostly seen in householders.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni rtog pas bsgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni rtog pas bsgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “conceptualization that is perfumed.🔽”

original: de la nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ma rig pas bsgribs pa gang dag yin pa dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos can bag med pa gang dag yin pa dang / khyim pa rtog pas bsgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni tshe 'di la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin bzhin du /
analyzed: de la nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ma rig pas bsgribs pa gang dag yin pa dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos can bag med pa gang dag yin pa dang / khyim pa rtog pas bsgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni tshe 'di la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin bzhin du /
translated: Those who are the subjects of the poorly explained Dharma, obscured by ignorance, those who are the subjects of the well explained Dharma, who are heedless, and those who are householders, stained by conceptualization, are causes of suffering in this life.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las sdug bsngal gyi rgyur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ci yang mi shes bas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la mngon par dga' ba'i ngo bor gnas te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las sdug bsngal gyi rgyur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ci yang mi shes bas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la mngon par dga' ba'i ngo bor gnas te /
translated: However, they do not know anything at all about the causes of suffering as they really are, in the sense of being causes of suffering. Therefore, they remain in the nature of delighting in the causes of suffering.

original: rgyu des phyi ma la de dag gi sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rgyu des phyi ma la de dag gi sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: By that cause, the suffering that arises for them in the future is

original: shin tu 'jigs pa chen po mi bzad pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa chen po mi bzad pa yin no //
translated: a very great, unbearable fear.

original: de la sems can nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams kyi skye mched drug gi rgyun ni ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i srol nas sdug bsngal gyi phyir 'bab po //
analyzed: de la sems can nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams kyi skye mched drug gi rgyun ni ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i srol nas sdug bsngal gyi phyir 'bab po //
translated: In this regard, the continuum of the six sense spheres of those who are the subjects of the poorly explained Dharma flows from the stream of the obscurations of ignorance to suffering.

original: khyim pa rnams kyi ni rtog pa'i srol nas so //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams kyi ni rtog pa'i srol nas so //
translated: For householders, it is from the stream of conceptualization.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos can rnams kyi skye mched drug gi rgyu ni bag med pa'i srol nas sdug bsngal gyi phyir 'bab ste /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos can rnams kyi skye mched drug gi rgyu ni bag med pa'i srol nas sdug bsngal gyi phyir 'bab ste /
translated: For those who possess the well-proclaimed Dharma, the cause of the six sense spheres is from the stream of heedlessness, for the sake of suffering.

original: ma rig pa'i sgrib pa dang / rtog pa dang / bag med pa'i srol gyi rgyun de dag gi rgyun 'jug pa de zlog pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgrib pa dang / rtog pa dang / bag med pa'i srol gyi rgyun de dag gi rgyun 'jug pa de zlog pa ni /
translated: The stream of the continuity of those streams of the obscurations of ignorance, conceptualization, and heedlessness is reversed

original: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyun las byung ba dang / so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyun las byung ba dang / so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas /
translated: through the stream that arises from the stream of the words of another and the stream that arises from the cause of one's own proper mental attention.

original: 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa yin te /
translated: It is mindfulness that possesses the apprehension of all formative predispositions as disadvantageous

original: rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po'i tshul gyis so //
translated: through the method of the antidote that is the thorough discernment.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lha bas bsdus pa'i shes rab kyis ni rgyun de dag gsum char yang 'jug pa'i rgyun gcod pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du gcod par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lha bas bsdus pa'i shes rab kyis ni rgyun de dag gsum char yang 'jug pa'i rgyun gcod pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du gcod par byed de /
translated: Through supramundane correct view that is subsumed within the path of seeing, the stream of those three is severed in every respect through the method of severing the stream of their continuity.

original: rgyun de rnam par gnon pas spong ba yang sdom pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyun de rnam par gnon pas spong ba yang sdom pa yin la /
translated: It is also a vow since it abandons that continuum through complete subjugation.🔽

original: gtan spong ba yang @258b sdom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan spong ba yang @258b sdom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is also a vow to suppress that stream, and it is also a vow to abandon it completely.

original: de la nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams dang / khyim pa rnams ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams dang / khyim pa rnams ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are devoted to the teaching of the bad law and the householders are definitely included in the side of defilement.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni gnyis dmigs te /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni gnyis dmigs te /
translated: Those who are devoted to the teaching of the good law are included in both sides.

original: bag med pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: bag med pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: The heedless are included in the side of defilement.

original: bag yod pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba'i gsal ba can yin no //
analyzed: bag yod pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba'i gsal ba can yin no //
translated: The heedful are included in the side of purification.

original: de la gsal bar byas pa gang yin pa dag dang / gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bag yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gsal bar byas pa gang yin pa dag dang / gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bag yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who are made clear and those who make clear are also to be known as heedful.

original: de la dgra bcom pa gsal bar byas pa de dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag la dran pa dang shes rab shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir dang / shes bzhin du rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir bag yod pa la bag yod par byed pa med kyi /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa gsal bar byas pa de dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag la dran pa dang shes rab shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir dang / shes bzhin du rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir bag yod pa la bag yod par byed pa med kyi /
translated: The arhats who are clearly manifest do not have mindfulness and wisdom that are cultivated in the four establishments of mindfulness, nor do they have heedfulness that is attained through pure vigilance.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa de 'gags pas de'i dran pa dang / shes rab kyang 'gag par 'gyur ba ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa de 'gags pas de'i dran pa dang / shes rab kyang 'gag par 'gyur ba ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the case that their mindfulness and wisdom do not cease when the extremely pure consciousness in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder ceases.

original: de'i de las gzhan pa sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi lhag ma chen por gtogs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i de las gzhan pa sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi lhag ma chen por gtogs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the remainder of name and form that is projected by previous karma and belongs to the great realm also ceases.

original: ji srid du 'gag par ma gyur pa de srid du yang rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug gis gnas shing nang gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa pa'i tshor ba dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod par gtogs pa'i tshor ba la yang mngon par dga' ba med de /
analyzed: ji srid du 'gag par ma gyur pa de srid du yang rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug gis gnas shing nang gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa pa'i tshor ba dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod par gtogs pa'i tshor ba la yang mngon par dga' ba med de /
translated: As long as they do not cease, they remain for a long time, abiding in the six abodes, free from internal desire, and they do not delight in external feelings belonging to the realm of desire.

original: de ltar dran pa dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa ni tshe ji srid par rnam par rgyu ba na rnam par shes pa de 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dran pa dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa ni tshe ji srid par rnam par rgyu ba na rnam par shes pa de 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the arhat who is endowed with mindfulness, while wandering for the duration of life, has that consciousness enter.

original: de la slob pa gang yin pa de dag la ni bag yod par byed pa yod de /
analyzed: de la slob pa gang yin pa de dag la ni bag yod par byed pa yod de /
translated: Those who are learners have heedfulness.

original: de dag la ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: They have clarity.

original: bag yod pa la bag yod par byed pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa la bag yod par byed pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Those who are heedful should be known as twofold:

original: slob pa tha dad pa re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa dang / rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa dag gi nang nas gang rtag tu byed cing byang bar byed pa'i slob pa /
analyzed: slob pa tha dad pa re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa dang / rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa dag gi nang nas gang rtag tu byed cing byang bar byed pa'i slob pa /
translated: If they are obstructed in their action, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their action.🔽If they are obstructed in their time, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their time.🔽If they are obstructed in their faculties, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their faculties.

original: gang tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i skal ba yod pa'i 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang @259a * //
analyzed: gang tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i skal ba yod pa'i 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang @259a * //
translated: If they are obstructed in their nature, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their nature.🔽If they are obstructed in their result, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their result.🔽If they are obstructed in their lineage, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their lineage.🔽If they are obstructed in their action, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their action.🔽If they are obstructed in their time, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their time.

original: mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba dang / de dag nyid spang ba'i phyir gnyen po sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba dang / de dag nyid spang ba'i phyir gnyen po sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: If they are obstructed in their faculties, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their faculties.🔽If they are obstructed in their nature, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their nature.🔽If they are obstructed in their result, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their result.🔽If they are obstructed in their lineage, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their lineage.🔽If they are obstructed in their action, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their action.🔽If they are obstructed in their time, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their time.🔽If they are obstructed in their faculties, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their faculties.🔽If they are obstructed in their nature, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their nature.🔽If they are obstructed in their result, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their result.🔽If they are obstructed in their lineage, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their lineage.🔽If they are obstructed in their action, they are the once returner who is obstructed in their action.

original: de la 'dod pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pas ni 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pas ni 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur la /
translated: If they are obstructed in

original: yid kyi rnyog pa med par byed pas ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnyog pa med par byed pas ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it makes the mind free from turbidity, it does not become defiled by the fetters that are favorable to the higher realms.

original: sdug bsngal gyi chos thams cad dang / kun 'byung ba nas nges par 'byung ba'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /🔽dan pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la shin tu gnas pa'i sems kyis gnas na mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi chos thams cad dang / kun 'byung ba nas nges par 'byung ba'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la / dan pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la shin tu gnas pa'i sems kyis gnas na mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He fully understands all things that are suffering, their origin, their cessation, and the path, just as they are.

original: lam ji ltar thob pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam ji ltar thob pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he dwells with a mind that is well-established in the four establishments of mindfulness, he follows the path as it has been attained in order to perfect it.

original: de ltar gnyen po sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar gnyen po sgom par byed do //
translated: Thus he cultivates the antidotes.

original: de tsam gyis na de'i bag yod la /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na de'i bag yod la /
translated: To that extent, his heedfulness

original: bag yod par byed pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //🔽bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag yod par byed pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no // bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: is complete in all its aspects.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: The summary of this explanation is as follows:🔽In brief,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim pa rnams dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / chos 'di pa rnams las kyang bag med pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim pa rnams dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / chos 'di pa rnams las kyang bag med pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The Blessed One has taught that householders and those outside this teaching are definitely defiled, and that even among those who are Buddhists, the heedless are defiled,

original: bag yod pa rnams ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar bstan te /
analyzed: bag yod pa rnams ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar bstan te /
translated: while the heedful are purified.

original: de ni 'dir mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽'dod pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang // gal te de yi de grub cing //
analyzed: de ni 'dir mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o // 'dod pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang // gal te de yi de grub cing //
translated: This is the brief teaching here.🔽If one obtains the desired object

original: ming ni ci dgar thob gyur na //
analyzed: ming ni ci dgar thob gyur na //
translated: and the name one wants,

original: yid ni mchog tu dga' bar 'gyur//🔽skye bo 'dun pa skyes gyur la //
analyzed: yid ni mchog tu dga' bar 'gyur// skye bo 'dun pa skyes gyur la //
translated: one’s mind is supremely happy.🔽But if the object of one’s desire

original: tshor ba de yi 'dod de dag / gal te yongs su nyams gyur na //
analyzed: tshor ba de yi 'dod de dag / gal te yongs su nyams gyur na //
translated: is lost,

original: zug rngu zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: zug rngu zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
translated: one is tormented, as if pierced by a thorn.

original: sbrul mgo las ni rkang pa bzhin //
analyzed: sbrul mgo las ni rkang pa bzhin //
translated: Like a snake’s head, desire is dangerous.

original: 'dod rnams spong ba gang yin de //
analyzed: 'dod rnams spong ba gang yin de //
translated: Those who abandon desire

original: 'jig rten dag na sred 'di las //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na sred 'di las //
translated: are freed from this craving in the world.

original: dran bzhin du ni 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dran bzhin du ni 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: And so, remembering, you pass away.🔽Fields, goods, cattle, horses, jewels, earrings,

original: zhing dngos dbyig dang ba lang dang // rta dang nor bu rna cha dang // bud med bran gyi 'dod rgyas la //
analyzed: zhing dngos dbyig dang ba lang dang // rta dang nor bu rna cha dang // bud med bran gyi 'dod rgyas la //
translated: Women, and servants—these are the things

original: mi ni mngon par zhen pa gang //
analyzed: mi ni mngon par zhen pa gang //
translated: That people are attached to.

original: stobs chen nyam chung bab pa bzhin //
analyzed: stobs chen nyam chung bab pa bzhin //
translated: They are like a great force that overpowers the weak.

original: de ni nyes 'dzag rnams kyis bcom //
analyzed: de ni nyes 'dzag rnams kyis bcom //
translated: They are destroyed by the flow of faults.

original: de phyir chur ni gru zhig ltar //
analyzed: de phyir chur ni gru zhig ltar //
translated: Therefore, like a shipwrecked sailor,

original: de ltar sdug @259b bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar sdug @259b bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: You will be overwhelmed by suffering.

original: ta la gtan nas gcad pa ltar //
analyzed: ta la gtan nas gcad pa ltar //
translated: Like a palm tree that has been cut down,

original: gang gis de ni bcad byas pa //
analyzed: gang gis de ni bcad byas pa //
translated: You will be cut down by the one who cuts you down.

original: de ni mya ngan ldog 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan ldog 'gyur te //
translated: You will be turned away from sorrow,

original: padma la ni chu thigs bzhin //
analyzed: padma la ni chu thigs bzhin //
translated: Like a water drop on a lotus leaf.

original: zhes bya ba ni don gyi sde tshan las 'dod pa rnams las brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don gyi sde tshan las 'dod pa rnams las brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: This verse is from the chapter on the meaning of desire.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir don du gnyer ba dang / thob pa rnams la da ltar so sor rten par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir don du gnyer ba dang / thob pa rnams la da ltar so sor rten par byed de /
translated: In this world, some people pursue future desires and cling to present ones.

original: de de ltar don du gnyer bar gyur cing so sor rten par byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang longs spyod de 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar don du gnyer bar gyur cing so sor rten par byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang longs spyod de 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: When one is intent on them, when one is attached to them, and when one obtains and enjoys them,

original: gzhi des de'i bde ba yang skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhi des de'i bde ba yang skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: then on that basis, one experiences pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: yid bde ba yang skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba yang skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the experience of pleasures.”

original: gal te de don du gnyer bar gyur cing /
analyzed: gal te de don du gnyer bar gyur cing /
translated: If one is intent on them,

original: 'dod pa de dag rnyed pa dang longs spyod las yongs su nyams par gyur na /🔽de 'dod pa'i ro myong ba dang ldan pa'i sred pa zug rngu sems la zhugs pa des /
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag rnyed pa dang longs spyod las yongs su nyams par gyur na / de 'dod pa'i ro myong ba dang ldan pa'i sred pa zug rngu sems la zhugs pa des /
translated: and if one loses the pleasures that one has obtained and enjoyed,

original: mi zug rdus zug pa bzhin du shin tu sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi zug rdus zug pa bzhin du shin tu sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: then one experiences the pain and mental dissatisfaction of the craving that is attached to the experience of pleasures.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //🔽de la 'dod pa rnams ni sprul lta bu yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs zhes bya'o // de la 'dod pa rnams ni sprul lta bu yin la /
translated: This is called “the disadvantage of pleasures.”🔽Pleasures are like a snake.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba ni sprul gyi mgo bo lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba ni sprul gyi mgo bo lta bu yin te /
translated: The experience of pleasures is like the head of a snake.

original: 'dod pa'i sbrul gyis 'dod pa'i ro myang ba la kun du chags shing mngon par zhen pa'i dug des byis pa rnams zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbrul gyis 'dod pa'i ro myang ba la kun du chags shing mngon par zhen pa'i dug des byis pa rnams zin to //
translated: The poison of attachment and clinging to the taste of sensual pleasures has seized the childish.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa de ni sbrul mgo log nas song ba bzhin du 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba la kun du chags pa spangs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa de ni sbrul mgo log nas song ba bzhin du 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba la kun du chags pa spangs nas /
translated: The noble disciple who is learned abandons attachment to the taste of sensual pleasures, like a snake that has cast off its skin.

original: chags pa med pa nas rgyas par mngon par zhen pa med par gyur pa'i bar gyis longs spyod par byed de /🔽de gzugs rnams la chags pa nas /
analyzed: chags pa med pa nas rgyas par mngon par zhen pa med par gyur pa'i bar gyis longs spyod par byed de / de gzugs rnams la chags pa nas /
translated: He enjoys them without attachment, up to without clinging.

original: reg bya rnams la 'dod pa'i sred pa'i bar gang yin pa'i chags pa de las /
analyzed: reg bya rnams la 'dod pa'i sred pa'i bar gang yin pa'i chags pa de las /
translated: Whatever attachment there is to forms, up to attachment to tactile objects, craving for sensual pleasures,

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul zhing spong la /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul zhing spong la /
translated: he subdues and abandons the desire for attachment.

original: yang dag par 'da' bas rgal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni 'dod pa rnams las nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'da' bas rgal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni 'dod pa rnams las nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: By transcending, he crosses over. This is the renunciation of sensual pleasures.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: 'dod pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: sensual pleasures have two natures.

original: dngos po'i 'dod pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'dod pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams so //
translated: The desire for things and the desire for afflictions.

original: de la dngos po'i 'dod pa rnams ni gang gi gzhi zhing gi dngos po yin pa'i 'bru @260a * //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i 'dod pa rnams ni gang gi gzhi zhing gi dngos po yin pa'i 'bru @260a * //
translated: The desire for things is the desire for grain, which is the thing that is the basis of a field,

original: dang / gang gi gzhi dbyig gi dngos po yin pa'i nor yin te /
analyzed: dang / gang gi gzhi dbyig gi dngos po yin pa'i nor yin te /
translated: and the desire for wealth, which is the thing that is the basis of money.

original: 'di ltar 'bru ni zhing las btsal bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bru ni zhing las btsal bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, grain is sought from a field,

original: dbyig ni rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba dang / tshong gnyis las btsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyig ni rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba dang / tshong gnyis las btsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and money is sought from a king, from a wage, or from trade.

original: zhing las 'bru btsal ba'i thabs ni ba lang ngo //
analyzed: zhing las 'bru btsal ba'i thabs ni ba lang ngo //
translated: The means of seeking grain from a field is cattle.

original: rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba las dbyig btsal pa'i thabs ni rta'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba las dbyig btsal pa'i thabs ni rta'o //
translated: The means of seeking money from a king or from a wage is a horse.

original: tshong las dbyig btsal ba'i thabs ni dbyig dang nor bus spras pa tha dad pa dag dang / dbyig gis spras pa'i rna cha gdub 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshong las dbyig btsal ba'i thabs ni dbyig dang nor bus spras pa tha dad pa dag dang / dbyig gis spras pa'i rna cha gdub 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: The means of seeking money from trade is the various kinds of jewelry and ornaments made of gold and jewels, and gold ornaments such as earrings and bracelets.

original: 'di ltar thabs kyi mchog 'di dag la sogs pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar thabs kyi mchog 'di dag la sogs pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, these supreme means and so on are as follows.

original: nyo tshong bya ba'i phyir tshong 'phrul gyi thabs gzhan dag kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyo tshong bya ba'i phyir tshong 'phrul gyi thabs gzhan dag kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should also know the other methods of commerce for the sake of buying and selling.

original: nor dang 'bru bsags nas rtse zhing dga' la /
analyzed: nor dang 'bru bsags nas rtse zhing dga' la /
translated: Having accumulated wealth and grain, one enjoys oneself and plays.

original: longs spyod pa'i grogs ni bud med rnams so //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i grogs ni bud med rnams so //
translated: Women are the companions for enjoyment.

original: ma bsags pa'i tshe bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / spel ba'i grogs ni bran rnams so //
analyzed: ma bsags pa'i tshe bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / spel ba'i grogs ni bran rnams so //
translated: When one has not accumulated, servants are the companions for acquiring, protecting, and increasing.

original: nor dang 'bru'i phung po mang po bsags nas /
analyzed: nor dang 'bru'i phung po mang po bsags nas /
translated: Having accumulated a great mass of wealth and grain,

original: rgud pa bsal ba'i phyir gter du sbed de /
analyzed: rgud pa bsal ba'i phyir gter du sbed de /
translated: one buries it as treasure in order to remove misfortune.

original: de dag ni dngos po'i 'dod pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po'i 'dod pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the aspects of desire for things.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the desires of affliction?

original: dngos po'i 'dod pa'i ro myang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'dod pa'i ro myang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the attachment to consciousness that follows the experience of the taste of desire for things, and it is the desire that is the conception of desire.

original: de dngos po'i 'dod pa de dag la nyon mongs pa'i 'dod bpas sems nyams smad nas /
analyzed: de dngos po'i 'dod pa de dag la nyon mongs pa'i 'dod bpas sems nyams smad nas /
translated: When one's mind is weakened by the desire for things and the desire of affliction,

original: dngos po' 'dod pa de dag 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dngos po' 'dod pa de dag 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur bas /
translated: Those who desire things are subject to change and transformation.🔽From that arise the faults of attachment,

original: nyes 'dzag dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes 'dzag dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: skyes nas kyang sems kun tu brdung ste gnas so //
analyzed: skyes nas kyang sems kun tu brdung ste gnas so //
translated: Having arisen, they torment the mind.

original: de ltar tshe 'di la nyes 'dzag gis zil gyis non te /
analyzed: de ltar tshe 'di la nyes 'dzag gis zil gyis non te /
translated: Thus, in this life, one is overcome by the faults of attachment.

original: gnyen po med par gyur pa de ni chu'i nang du gru zhig pa dang 'dra bar phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag rnams rjes su 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po med par gyur pa de ni chu'i nang du gru zhig pa dang 'dra bar phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag rnams rjes su 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one becomes devoid of antidotes, then, like a shipwrecked sailor, one will be subject in the next life to the various sufferings of birth, old age, and death.

original: 'dod pa rnams las nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i 'dod pa'i ro myang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhen pa dang ldan pa de ni ta la gtan nas @260b drung nas bcad na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa bzhin du thams🔽cad kyi thams cad du chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i 'dod pa'i ro myang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhen pa dang ldan pa de ni ta la gtan nas @260b drung nas bcad na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa bzhin du thams cad kyi thams cad du chad par 'gyur te /
translated: so too, when the consciousness that is attached to the experience of the taste of sense pleasures is completely severed, it will not arise again.

original: de'i dngos po'i 'dod pa sdug pa nas yid du 'ong ba'i bar de dag 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i 'dod pa sdug pa nas yid du 'ong ba'i bar de dag 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur bas /
translated: Since the things that are desired, from the attractive to the delightful, change and become different,

original: padma'i 'dab ma la chu'i thigs pa mi chags pa bzhin du /
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la chu'i thigs pa mi chags pa bzhin du /
translated: just as a drop of water does not remain on a lotus leaf,

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa de la mya ngan la sogs pas gnas mi thod do //🔽bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa de la mya ngan la sogs pas gnas mi thod do // bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: grief and so on will not remain in that pure consciousness.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: The summary of this explanation is as follows:🔽In brief,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / ro myang bas byas pa'i nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung bas byas pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / ro myang bas byas pa'i nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung bas byas pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: The Lord has taught the enjoyment of desires, their danger, their escape, their nature, the danger created by enjoyment, and the benefit created by escape.

original: de ni 'dir mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽'das la rjes su 'gro mi byed //
analyzed: de ni 'dir mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o // 'das la rjes su 'gro mi byed //
translated: This should be understood as the brief teaching here.🔽Do not pursue the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa la re ba med //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la re ba med //
translated: Do not anticipate the future.

original: da ltar byung chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung chos gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is present

original: de dang de la rnam lta la //🔽mi 'phrogs kun du mi 'khrugs pa //
analyzed: de dang de la rnam lta la // mi 'phrogs kun du mi 'khrugs pa //
translated: Look at it, just that,🔽The wise increase it,

original: de ni mkhas pas 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: de ni mkhas pas 'phel bar byed //
translated: unshakable, imperturbable.

original: ces bya ba ni mtshan mo bzang po'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mtshan mo bzang po'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: This is a verse of the Bhadrakaratri-sutra.

original: 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa rnyed nas /
translated: Here someone, having gained faith in the Dharma and Discipline taught by the Tathagata,

original: dad pas khyim nas khyim med par legs pa kho nar rab tu byung la /
analyzed: dad pas khyim nas khyim med par legs pa kho nar rab tu byung la /
translated: with faith goes forth from home to homelessness.

original: de rnam pa lngas tshangs par spyod pa shin tu yongs su dag par spyod de /
analyzed: de rnam pa lngas tshangs par spyod pa shin tu yongs su dag par spyod de /
translated: He practices pure conduct that is completely pure in five ways.

original: des khyim gyi 'du byed gang ngag yongs su btang ba de dag la mi lta zhing /
analyzed: des khyim gyi 'du byed gang ngag yongs su btang ba de dag la mi lta zhing /
translated: He does not look back at the household activities that he has given up.

original: de dag skyed par yang mi sems /
analyzed: de dag skyed par yang mi sems /
translated: He does not think about them.

original: phyir len par yang mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa dang po'o //
analyzed: phyir len par yang mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa dang po'o //
translated: He does not take them back. This is the first aspect.

original: gzhan yang tshe 'di la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang ldan pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshe 'di la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang ldan pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang mi 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, he does not desire future household activities that are connected with the acquisitions and honors of this life.

original: phyi ma'i lha dang mi rnams kyi 'du byed rnams kyi phyir yang smon lam 'debs shing tshangs par spyod par mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i lha dang mi rnams kyi 'du byed rnams kyi phyir yang smon lam 'debs shing tshangs par spyod par mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: He does not practice pure conduct in order to make prayers for the sake of future household activities among gods and humans. This is the second aspect.

original: gzhan yang gang de'i nye bar len pa'i phung por gtogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i chos da ltar byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag la de gnas nas 'di ltar yang dag par rnam par lta ba por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang de'i nye bar len pa'i phung por gtogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i chos da ltar byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag la de gnas nas 'di ltar yang dag par rnam par lta ba por 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, he abides in the present dharmas of form, etc., that are included in the appropriating aggregates. He then correctly observes them in the following way:

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma la yang sdig pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma la yang sdig pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur bas /
translated: Because physical misdeeds are sinful in terms of their karmic maturation in this life and the next,

original: gal te bdag gi lus kyis nyes par @261a * //🔽spyod pa spyad na ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi lus kyis nyes par @261a * // spyod pa spyad na ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: if I engage in physical misdeeds,🔽up to

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa spangs nas /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa spangs nas /
translated: having abandoned physical misdeeds,

original: lus kyis legs par spyod pa bsgom pa'i bar du rgyas par mdo las byung ba bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: lus kyis legs par spyod pa bsgom pa'i bar du rgyas par mdo las byung ba bzhin du sbyar te /

original: ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams mi rtag par yang dag par mthong ste /🔽gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams mi rtag par yang dag par mthong ste / gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: One should understand that verbal and mental good conduct are similar to that, and one sees that the aggregates of form and so on that have arisen, have not arisen, and are arising are impermanent.🔽Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Whatever is suffering is not self.

original: gang la bdag med pa de dag thams cad ni bdag gi ma yin pa dang / de ni bdag ma yin pa dang / de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin par de de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba 'di ni rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa de dag thams cad ni bdag gi ma yin pa dang / de ni bdag ma yin pa dang / de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin par de de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba 'di ni rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third aspect is to see with correct wisdom, just as it is, that all that is not a self is not one’s self, that it is not one’s self, and that it is not one’s self’s self.

original: gzhan yang chos la rnam par lta ba dang po la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos la rnam par lta ba dang po la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, based on the first kind of observation of dharmas,

original: phyi ma la mngon par skyo bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma la mngon par skyo bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to become disgusted with the future,

original: dbang po yongs su smin pas /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pas /
translated: one ripens one’s faculties

original: rgyal po la sogs pas dbrog tu med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel bar byed pa de ni rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas dbrog tu med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel bar byed pa de ni rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: and increases one’s accumulations of merit and wisdom, which cannot be taken away by kings and so on. This is the fourth aspect.

original: gzhan yang de chos la rnam par lta ba cig shos la brten nas tshe 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis kun du mi 'khrugs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'phel bar byed pa 'di ni rnam pa lnga pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de chos la rnam par lta ba cig shos la brten nas tshe 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis kun du mi 'khrugs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'phel bar byed pa 'di ni rnam pa lnga pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, based on the other, that is, the Dharma, one increases the nirvāṇa that is not disturbed by any afflictions and secondary afflictions in this very life. This is the fifth aspect.

original: de rnam pa lngas shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: de rnam pa lngas shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa de ni /
translated: Through these five aspects, one abides in the extremely pure pure conduct.

original: mtshan gcig tsam gnas na yang bzang zhing mchog tu bzang ba yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gcig tsam gnas na yang bzang zhing mchog tu bzang ba yin te /
translated: Even if one abides in it for only one night, it is good and supremely good.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa thams cad las yang dag par 'phags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa thams cad las yang dag par 'phags par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as superior to all abodes in pure conduct.

original: bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The summary of this explanation is as follows.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa thun mong ma yin pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa thun mong ma yin pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa /

original: shin tu yongs su dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag pa bstan te /
translated: and is extremely pure.

original: de ni 'dir mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: sdom la / sdig dang brjod bya 'dod chags dang // chu bo dang ni 'jigs dang rigs //

original: grags ldan mtsho dang chu bo gnyis //
analyzed: grags ldan mtsho dang chu bo gnyis //
translated: the two famous ones, ocean and river,🔽attachment, anger, action,🔽grasping, attaining the goal,🔽impermanence, heedfulness, and attachment,

analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang bya ba @261b dang // 'dzin pa dang ni don thob dang // mi rtag pa dang bag yod dang // 'dod chags shas che chos la gnas //
translated: the Dharma abides.🔽Certainty, permanence, good speech,🔽faith, and learning,

original: nges rtag legs par smras pa dang // dad pa dang ni thos pa dang // nam mkha' mtshungs dang gzugs dang rgyal //
analyzed: nges rtag legs par smras pa dang // dad pa dang ni thos pa dang // nam mkha' mtshungs dang gzugs dang rgyal //
translated: space-like, form, and victory,🔽bone-fence, turtle-like,🔽swamp, two abodes,🔽endeavor, and giving,🔽all sins, downfalls,

original: rus pa'i ra ba rus sbal dang// mtshungs dang 'dam dang gnas gnyis dang // brtsal gyur dang ni byin pa dang // sdig pa kun dang ltung ba dang // mkhas dang bzo dang ring du 'gro //
analyzed: rus pa'i ra ba rus sbal dang// mtshungs dang 'dam dang gnas gnyis dang // brtsal gyur dang ni byin pa dang // sdig pa kun dang ltung ba dang // mkhas dang bzo dang ring du 'gro //

analyzed: bsgribs dang 'dod dang bzang po yin //
translated: obstructed, desire, and good.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: From the Bodhisattva Levels,

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i sa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i sa rdzogs so /
translated: the chapter on the stage of the wisdom arisen from contemplation is complete.

original: // / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage that is born of cultivation?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa ni gnas bzhis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be known that the stage that is born of cultivation is included in four stations.

original: gnas bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas bzhi gang zhe na /

analyzed: bsgom ba'i gzhi dang / bsgom pa'i rgyu dang / rnal 'byor du bsgom pa nyid dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: gnas bzhi po 'di dag kyang yan lag bdun gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste /

original: yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven members?

original: mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa dang /

original: gnyen po bsgom pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dag pa ste /🔽yan lag bdun gyis bsdus pa'i gnas bzhi po 'di dag gis ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dag pa ste / yan lag bdun gyis bsdus pa'i gnas bzhi po 'di dag gis ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: the cultivation of antidotes, the complete purification of the mundane, and the complete purification of the supramundane.

original: bstan pa'i don mtha' dag rgyas par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don mtha' dag rgyas par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: These four topics, which are included in the seven branches, should be understood as elaborating the entire meaning of the teaching, beginning with the complete fulfillment of all the bases of training in this well-expounded Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de la mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of accomplishment?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
translated: it should be regarded as having ten aspects:

original: nang la brten te rnam pa lnga dang / phyi rol la brten te rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: nang la brten te rnam pa lnga dang / phyi rol la brten te rnam pa lnga ste /

analyzed: nang dang phyi rol la brten nas rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nang la brten te mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five aspects of the excellence of accomplishment that are based on the internal?

analyzed: ris mthun pa phun sum tshogs pa @262a * //

analyzed: dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mos pa sgrib pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: 5. the perfection of the absence of obstacles to aspiration.

original: ris mthun pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ris mthun pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of the same type of birth?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rnams kyi nang du skyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rnams kyi nang du skyes par 'gyur te /
