analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po dang yang ldan pa'o //
translated: and he has the male organ.

original: yul phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of the country?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rnams kyi nang du skyes la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rnams kyi nang du skyes la /
translated: Here a person is born among human beings,

original: dbus kyi yul du yang skyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbus kyi yul du yang skyes par 'gyur te /
translated: and he is born in a central country,🔽not in a border country where the four groups of the faithful do not go:🔽monks,🔽nuns,

original: mtha' 'khob gang du 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma mi 'gro ba der ni mi skye'i /
analyzed: mtha' 'khob gang du 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma mi 'gro ba der ni mi skye'i /
translated: male lay followers,🔽and female lay followers.

original: gang du 'khor bzhi po rnams 'gro ba dang / rkun ma ma yin pa dang / kla klo ma yin pa dang / gang du 'phags pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams 'gro ba de dang der skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du 'khor bzhi po rnams 'gro ba dang / rkun ma ma yin pa dang / kla klo ma yin pa dang / gang du 'phags pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams 'gro ba de dang der skyes pa yin no //
translated: where there are noble ones, those who have entered the right path, those who have entered the right path, and good people.

original: lus phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is perfection of body?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la dbus kyi yul du yang skyes la /🔽mig ma tshang ba yang med /🔽rna ba ma tshang ba yang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la dbus kyi yul du yang skyes la / mig ma tshang ba yang med / rna ba ma tshang ba yang med /
translated: Here someone is born in a central country,🔽not lacking any faculties,🔽not lacking any limbs,

original: yan lag dang nying lag gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba yang med /🔽blun po yang ma yin /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba yang med / blun po yang ma yin /
translated: not lacking any organs,🔽not stupid,

original: dig pa dang / lkugs pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dig pa dang / lkugs pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: not mute,

original: legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don rtogs par bya ba'i mthu yang yod pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don rtogs par bya ba'i mthu yang yod pa'o //
translated: and has the ability to understand the meaning of what is well spoken and what is badly spoken.

original: las kyi sgrib pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is perfection of freedom from obstacles?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la lus phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la lus phun sum tshogs par yang 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, here someone has a perfect body,

original: mtshams med pa lnga las mtshams med pa gang yang rung ba gang byas na de phung po 'di dag nyid kyis 'phags pa'i chos 'thob pa'i snod du mi rung ba kho nar 'gyur ba ma byas la byed du yang ma bcug ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga las mtshams med pa gang yang rung ba gang byas na de phung po 'di dag nyid kyis 'phags pa'i chos 'thob pa'i snod du mi rung ba kho nar 'gyur ba ma byas la byed du yang ma bcug ba'o //
translated: but has not committed any of the five heinous actions, nor caused anyone else to do so, which would make them unfit to obtain the noble dharmas with this very body.

original: mos pa sgrib pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa sgrib pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of being free of obscurations with regard to interest?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mtshams med pa'i las rnams dang yang mi ldan la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mtshams med pa'i las rnams dang yang mi ldan la / 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, here someone is not endowed with the actions of immediate retribution,🔽and is not endowed with the actions of the lower realms.🔽That is, they do not have an interest in or faith in the lower realms,

original: lha'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dang / mu stegs can gyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas ngan par mos pa med cing gnas ngan par @262b mngon par dad pa med kyi /
analyzed: lha'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dang / mu stegs can gyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas ngan par mos pa med cing gnas ngan par @262b mngon par dad pa med kyi /
translated: such as the various abodes of the gods or the various abodes of the tīrthikas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gnas bzang po la dad pas sngon gyi tshe rabs nas de'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gnas bzang po la dad pas sngon gyi tshe rabs nas de'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pas /
translated: Rather, they have faith in the well-established teaching of the Tathāgata, and due to the cause of that in previous lives, they are fully matured.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des da ltar de'i mos pa dang ba dang ldan pa 'phags pa'i gnas de nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des da ltar de'i mos pa dang ba dang ldan pa 'phags pa'i gnas de nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: By that cause and that condition, now he has faith and is endowed with devotion, and he abides in that very holy state.

original: phyi rol la brten te /
analyzed: phyi rol la brten te /
translated: By that cause and that condition, he now has faith and is endowed with that faith, and he abides in that very state of the noble ones.

original: mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfect accomplishment based on external factors?

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / brda las byung ba'i chos gdags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / don dam pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsgrub pa med par mi 'gyur ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / brda las byung ba'i chos gdags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / don dam pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsgrub pa med par mi 'gyur ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: It is the perfect accomplishment of the teacher, the perfect designation of the Dharma that arises from signs, the perfect engagement in the ultimate Dharma, the perfect non-degeneration without practice,

original: mthun pa'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and the perfect favorable conditions.

original: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfect accomplishment of the teacher?

original: 'di ltar gang zag de de ltar nang la brten te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag de de ltar nang la brten te /
translated: Thus, that person, having in that way based himself on the internal,

original: mngon bar 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga la yang gnas la /
analyzed: mngon bar 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga la yang gnas la /
translated: and having also accomplished the perfect fivefold accomplishment,

original: ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: the teacher, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: He is the Omniscient One.

original: thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: He is the All-Seeing One.

original: shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa yang 'jig rten du byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa yang 'jig rten du byung ba'o //
translated: He has attained the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all that is to be known.

original: brda las byung ba'i chos gdags pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: brda las byung ba'i chos gdags pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfect designation of the Dharma that arises from the signs?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid 'jig rten du byung ba de nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid 'jig rten du byung ba de nyid kyis /
translated: It is the Tathāgata himself who, having appeared in the world,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams nas rgyas par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kyi bar du gnyen po dang bcas pa yang dag bar rab tu ston te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams nas rgyas par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kyi bar du gnyen po dang bcas pa yang dag bar rab tu ston te /
translated: teaches the remedies for all the wholesome and unwholesome dharmas, for the dharmas that are reprehensible, for the dharmas that are not reprehensible, and so on, extensively up to the dharmas that are dependent origination.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /🔽skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab pa bstan pa'i sde'i chos dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab pa bstan pa'i sde'i chos dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the sutra class, the geya class, the vyakarana class, the gatha class, the udana class, the nidana class, the avadana class, the itivrttaka class,🔽the jataka class, the vaipulya class, the adbhutadharma class, and the upadesa class.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams nas /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams nas /
translated: He teaches the wholesome and unwholesome dharmas, those with and without outflows,

original: rgyas par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba cha dang bcas pa rnams kyi bar du yang dag @263a * //🔽par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba cha dang bcas pa rnams kyi bar du yang dag @263a * // par ston pa'o //
translated: up to the twelve links of dependent origination in their entirety.

original: don dam pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is following the Dharma of ultimate meaning?

original: ston pas de ltar brda las byung ba'i dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa la nyan pa pos brda las byung ba'i dam pa'i chos de nyid la yang brten /
analyzed: ston pas de ltar brda las byung ba'i dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa la nyan pa pos brda las byung ba'i dam pa'i chos de nyid la yang brten /
translated: The listener, relying on that holy Dharma that has come from the signs,

original: gzhan gyi gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa dang mthun pa la yang brten nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa dang mthun pa la yang brten nas /
translated: and relying on the instructions and teachings of others,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms te /
translated: cultivates the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par yang 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par yang 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: He attains the fruits of the religious life and the perfection of the fruits of the religious life.

original: de'i 'og tu gong nas gong du rtogs pa rgya che zhing 'phel la spangs pa yang yod pa'o//
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gong nas gong du rtogs pa rgya che zhing 'phel la spangs pa yang yod pa'o//
translated: After that, his understanding increases more and more, and his abandonment increases.

original: bsgrub pa med par mi 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub pa med par mi 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice that is not lost?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang rung /🔽bzhugs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang rung / bzhugs kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathagata is in nirvana or not,🔽whether the holy Dharma has disappeared or not,

original: brda las byung ba'i dam pa'i chos la /
analyzed: brda las byung ba'i dam pa'i chos la /
translated: the holy Dharma that has come from the signs

original: don dam pa'i chos med par mi 'gyur zhing rgyun mi 'chad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos med par mi 'gyur zhing rgyun mi 'chad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: is not lost, and its continuity is not interrupted.

original: mthun pa'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthun pa'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of favorable conditions?

original: 'di ltar chos kyi longs spyod kyi rgyur nye bar gnas pa bzhi po 'di dag gis chos kyi longs spyod la zhugs par bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad pa rnams kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi longs spyod kyi rgyur nye bar gnas pa bzhi po 'di dag gis chos kyi longs spyod la zhugs par bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad pa rnams kyis rtogs nas /
translated: When the faithful brahmins and householders understand that the bodhisattva is engaged in the enjoyment of the Dharma through these four factors that are the cause of the enjoyment of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi longs spyod la brtson pa 'di /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod la brtson pa 'di /
translated: they think, “This one is intent on the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: zang zing gi longs spyod dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod dang mi ldan pas /
translated: If he were to lack the enjoyment of material things,🔽it would be a hindrance to the enjoyment of the Dharma.”🔽Thus, they provide him with Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, a seat, and medicines for curing the sick,

original: chos kyi longs spyod nyams par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas de dag la chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams kyis shin tu stobs par byed pa ste /🔽'di ni nang dang phyi rol la brten te /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod nyams par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas de dag la chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams kyis shin tu stobs par byed pa ste / 'di ni nang dang phyi rol la brten te /
translated: so that he may be well-provided with the necessities of life.

original: mngon par grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the excellence of the accomplishment of the ten kinds of inner and outer favorable conditions.

original: mngon par grub pa phun sum tshogs pa bcu po de dag la ni rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i gzhi dang / rten dang / gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa phun sum tshogs pa bcu po de dag la ni rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i gzhi dang / rten dang / gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: These ten perfections of manifest realization are called the basis, support, and abode of the cultivation of yoga.

original: de la brten cing gnas na /
analyzed: de la brten cing gnas na /
translated: If one relies on and abides in them,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will attain the noble qualities of the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas.

original: de la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: Here, the noble qualities are, in brief,

original: slob pa'i chos rnams dang / mi slob pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams dang / mi slob pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: the qualities of training and the qualities of no longer training.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams la 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams la 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: In this context, the noble qualities are intended to refer to the qualities of no longer training.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag par lta ba @263b nas /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag par lta ba @263b nas /
translated: from the correct view of no longer training

original: rgyas par yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgyas par yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the extensive correct knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar slob pa'i chos rnams kyang 'phags ba'i chos rnams yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob pa'i chos rnams kyang 'phags ba'i chos rnams yin mod kyi /
translated: It is because, although the qualities of training are also noble qualities,

original: 'phags pa'i ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yang 'brel par rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yang 'brel par rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen to be associated with the afflictions of ordinary beings.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽yan lag dang po mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa 'di ni bstan pa'i don du gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / yan lag dang po mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa 'di ni bstan pa'i don du gyur pa /
translated: It is as follows:🔽The first member, the perfection of establishment, is to be known as the subject matter of the teaching,

original: rgyas par byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and as the cause of its expansion.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: It has ten aspects.

original: mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di las gong na yang med /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di las gong na yang med /
translated: The perfection of establishment is not higher than this,

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: and there is nothing higher than this.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of listening to the holy Dharma?

original: yang dag par bstan pa gang yin pa dang / yang dag par mnyan pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa la ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa gang yin pa dang / yang dag par mnyan pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa la ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of listening to the holy Dharma is the combination of the two, the perfect teaching and the perfect listening.

original: yang dag par bstan pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The perfect teaching, in brief, is of two kinds:

original: mthun pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: that which is in conformity with the Dharma and that which is not defiled.

original: de yang rgyas par ni rnam pa nyi shur rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang rgyas par ni rnam pa nyi shur rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be known in detail as twenty kinds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ngo //
translated: It is as stated in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: yang dag par nyan pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag par nyan pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Again, correct listening is also of four kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: khengs pa med pa dang / brnyas pa med pa dang / bag 'khums pa med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa ste /
analyzed: khengs pa med pa dang / brnyas pa med pa dang / bag 'khums pa med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa ste /
translated: without arrogance, without contempt, without timidity, and without distraction.

original: nyes pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag spangs nas nyan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag spangs nas nyan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Listening after having abandoned these four faults is called

original: yang dag par nyan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par nyan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: correct listening.

original: de yang rgyas par ni rnam pa bcu drug tu rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang rgyas par ni rnam pa bcu drug tu rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be known in detail as sixteen kinds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa de nyid las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa de nyid las 'byung ngo //
translated: It is as stated in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gtso bor byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gtso bor byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one that makes nirvana primary?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos de mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa de la gnas pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos de mngon par 'grub pa phun sum tshogs pa de la gnas pa na /
translated: When the sravaka of the Tathagata, having attained this perfect accomplishment,

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam pa lta bur chos nyan te /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam pa lta bur chos nyan te /
translated: They listen to the Dharma in the manner that has been taught.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kho nar gtso bor byas shing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kho nar gtso bor byas shing /
translated: They make nirvana their primary focus.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kho na don du gnyer la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kho na don du gnyer la /
translated: They strive for nirvana alone.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kho na las dmigs pa byas nas nyan par byed kyi /🔽pha rol 'dun par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i @264a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kho na las dmigs pa byas nas nyan par byed kyi / pha rol 'dun par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i @264a * //
translated: They listen to the Dharma with nirvana as their frame of reference.

original: phyir ni ma yin no //🔽de mya ngan las 'das pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyir ni ma yin no // de mya ngan las 'das pa 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not listen to the Dharma for the sake of gaining the approval of others, for the sake of pleasing others, for the sake of gain, honor, fame, praise, or reputation.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las brtsams te /🔽dmigs pa dang bcas pas chos nyan na /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las brtsams te / dmigs pa dang bcas pas chos nyan na /
translated: They listen to the Dharma with a frame of reference that is focused on nirvana, that is to say, on the nirvana in which the heaps remain and the nirvana in which the heaps do not remain.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i phyi'i chos bcu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i phyi'i chos bcu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they listen to the Dharma with a frame of reference that is focused on nirvana, ten qualities that are focused on nirvana will arise.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa brtsams nas ni /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa brtsams nas ni /
translated: When they listen to the Dharma with a frame of reference that is focused on the nirvana in which the heaps remain,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gtso bor byed pa'i chos dgur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gtso bor byed pa'i chos dgur rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that these are the nine dharmas which have nirvana as their principal aim.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las brtsams nas ni /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las brtsams nas ni /
translated: Beginning with nirvana without remainder,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i chos gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i chos gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: one should know that there is one dharma which has nirvana as its principal aim.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab de nyid la brten nas /
translated: Based on that very wisdom which arises from hearing,

original: lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa las mngon par yid ches pa rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa las mngon par yid ches pa rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: there arises a threefold conviction regarding the path, the result of the path, and nirvana.

original: yod pa nyid du yid ches pa dang / yon tan can yin par yid ches pa dang / bdag gis thob par nus pa dang thabs sla ba yin par yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du yid ches pa dang / yon tan can yin par yid ches pa dang / bdag gis thob par nus pa dang thabs sla ba yin par yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes convinced of their existence, one becomes convinced of their excellence, and one becomes convinced that one is able to attain them and that the means are easy.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir de ltar yid ches par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir de ltar yid ches par gyur pa ni /
translated: One who has become convinced in this way, in order to accomplish the wisdom which arises from reflection,

original: lus dang sems dben par gnas shing sgrib pa dang / rtog pa las dben par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems dben par gnas shing sgrib pa dang / rtog pa las dben par 'gyur ro //
translated: dwells in solitude of body and mind and becomes free from obscurations and conceptual thoughts.

original: de la brten nas kyang don shin tu rnam par nges pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i rjes su 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas kyang don shin tu rnam par nges pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i rjes su 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And on the basis of that, one will achieve the knowledge that arises from reflection, which is very certain in meaning.

original: de la brten nas kyang sgom pa rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la brten nas kyang sgom pa rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: And on the basis of that, one will engage in the practice of constant and respectful meditation.

original: go rims 'dis bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bar du thob la /
analyzed: go rims 'dis bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bar du thob la /
translated: And by this sequence, one will attain the knowledge that arises from meditation.

original: de la brten nas kyang 'khor ba la yang nyes par lta ba'i mos pa rtsom la mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yon tan du lta ba'i mos pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: de la brten nas kyang 'khor ba la yang nyes par lta ba'i mos pa rtsom la mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yon tan du lta ba'i mos pa rtsom mo //
translated: And on the basis of that, one will begin to conceive of the faults of cyclic existence and the virtues of nirvana.

original: de la goms nas kyang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa mngon du 'gro ba'i mthong ba'i lam slob pa'i rnam par grol ba 'thob cing gzhi mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la goms nas kyang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa mngon du 'gro ba'i mthong ba'i lam slob pa'i rnam par grol ba 'thob cing gzhi mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: And having become accustomed to that, one will attain the path of seeing, which is the direct realization of the truths, and the liberation of the trainee, and will see the basic reality.

original: de'i gong du bsgom pa'i lam goms pas mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba thob pas /
analyzed: de'i gong du bsgom pa'i lam goms pas mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba thob pas /
translated: And above that, by cultivating the path of meditation, one will attain the liberation of the non-trainee.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And thus one will complete the liberation.

original: de la rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The complete perfection of liberation is as follows.

original: phung @264b po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kho na'o //
analyzed: phung @264b po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kho na'o //
translated: The complete liberation is the element of nirvana with remainder of aggregates.

original: de la dang po'i chos dgu ni mya ngan las 'das pa de bsgrub pa'i phyir gtso bor go rims bzhin du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la dang po'i chos dgu ni mya ngan las 'das pa de bsgrub pa'i phyir gtso bor go rims bzhin du 'byung ngo //
translated: The first nine qualities are the principal ones for the attainment of that nirvana, in that order.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de'i gtso bo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de'i gtso bo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The complete liberation is the principal one for the nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i chos nyan pa de la phan yon rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i chos nyan pa de la phan yon rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the listener who makes nirvana principal has five benefits.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: nyan pa'i tshe pha rol la phan 'dogs pa dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang / sgrub pa'i tshe pha rol la phan 'dogs pa dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad mthar byed pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa'i tshe pha rol la phan 'dogs pa dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang / sgrub pa'i tshe pha rol la phan 'dogs pa dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad mthar byed pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: When listening, one benefits others and oneself. When practicing, one benefits others and oneself. One attains the end of all suffering.

original: chos smra ba pos gang gi don du chos ston pa de nyid kyi bsam pas nyan par byed pa ni /
analyzed: chos smra ba pos gang gi don du chos ston pa de nyid kyi bsam pas nyan par byed pa ni /
translated: When listening to the Dharma, one should listen with the very same attitude with which the Dharma teacher teaches the Dharma.

original: nyan pa'i tshe pha rol la phan 'dogs pa yin la /
analyzed: nyan pa'i tshe pha rol la phan 'dogs pa yin la /
translated: When listening, one benefits others.

original: dge ba'i bsam pas nyan pas ni brjod pa'i chos kyi don rgya chen po rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pas nyan pas ni brjod pa'i chos kyi don rgya chen po rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When listening with a virtuous attitude, one will understand the vast meaning of the Dharma that is being taught.

original: des na dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge zhing nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge zhing nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one will attain vast, virtuous, and liberating joy and supreme joy.

original: de ltar na nyan pa'i tshe bdag la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyan pa'i tshe bdag la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, when listening, one benefits oneself.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sbyor ba gang gi ched du ston pas chos bshad cing yang dag par bstan la /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sbyor ba gang gi ched du ston pas chos bshad cing yang dag par bstan la /
translated: The application of practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma is the practice for the sake of which the Teacher explains and teaches the Dharma.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i yang dag par sgrub pa de la gnas na /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i yang dag par sgrub pa de la gnas na /
translated: If one abides in that practice of perfect realization that is fully enlightened,

original: bsgrub pa'i tshe chos nyid kyis ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pas pha rol la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i tshe chos nyid kyis ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pas pha rol la phan 'dogs so //
translated: then at the time of practice, one benefits others by naturally serving the Teacher.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa de nyid la brten nas /
translated: Based on that very practice of perfect realization,

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mchog tu bsil bar gyur pa thob pa ni sgrub pa'i tshe bdag nyid la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mchog tu bsil bar gyur pa thob pa ni sgrub pa'i tshe bdag nyid la phan 'dogs so //
translated: one attains the supreme cooling of nirvana with remainder, which is the benefit to oneself at the time of practice.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One attains the end of all suffering, which is complete nirvana in the expanse of nirvana without remainder.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa phan yon dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa phan yon dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the benefit of nirvana with its advantages.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i don rgyas pa yin te /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa'i don rgyas pa yin te / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the meaning of the foremost nirvana.🔽There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang @265a * //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang @265a * //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: med do // rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: med do // rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the maturity of wisdom that brings about the maturity of complete liberation?

original: lhag mthong gi yan lag yongs su smin pas kyang shes rab yongs su smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi yan lag yongs su smin pas kyang shes rab yongs su smin par 'gyur la /
translated: Wisdom is brought to maturity through the maturity of the branches of insight.

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag yongs su smin pas kyang shes rab yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag yongs su smin pas kyang shes rab yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Wisdom is brought to maturity through the maturity of the branches of serenity.

original: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na shes rab shes bya la 'jug pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na shes rab shes bya la 'jug pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when the mind is in a state of concentration, the wisdom that engages objects of knowledge becomes purified.

original: de la lhag mthong gi yan lag ni thog ma kho nar bshes gnyen dam pa la yang dag par brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhag mthong gi yan lag ni thog ma kho nar bshes gnyen dam pa la yang dag par brten pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the branch of insight is the initial reliance on a true spiritual teacher.

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The branch of serenity is the possession of perfect morality.

original: del bshes gnyen dam pa yongs su 'dzin pa brtsams pas ni shes bya'i de kho na rtogs par bya ba la 'dun par 'gyur ba'o //🔽tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa brtsams pas ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims nyams pa dang / de bzhin du cho ga las cho ga nyams pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa shes pa rnams kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang /
analyzed: del bshes gnyen dam pa yongs su 'dzin pa brtsams pas ni shes bya'i de kho na rtogs par bya ba la 'dun par 'gyur ba'o // tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa brtsams pas ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims nyams pa dang / de bzhin du cho ga las cho ga nyams pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa shes pa rnams kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang /
translated: By undertaking to follow a holy person, one becomes intent on understanding the reality of what is to be known.🔽By undertaking to follow perfect morality, one becomes patient with the words of those who point out transgressions of morality, transgressions of ritual, and transgressions of livelihood, whether they do so out of desire to benefit, or out of desire for material reward, or out of desire to conform with a crowd, or out of confusion.

original: dogs pa las gleng ba'am /🔽dran par byed pa'am /
analyzed: dogs pa las gleng ba'am / dran par byed pa'am /
translated: One becomes patient with the words of those who point out transgressions of morality, transgressions of ritual, and transgressions of livelihood, whether they do so out of desire to benefit, or out of desire for material reward, or out of desire to conform with a crowd, or out of confusion.

original: rjes su slob par byed pa'i tshig bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su slob par byed pa'i tshig bzod pa'o //
translated: One becomes patient with the words of those who point out transgressions of morality, transgressions of ritual, and transgressions of livelihood, whether they do so out of desire to benefit, or out of desire for material reward, or out of desire to conform with a crowd, or out of confusion.

original: shes bya'i de kho na rtogs par bya ba la 'dun pa de la brten pas ni nyan 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i de kho na rtogs par bya ba la 'dun pa de la brten pas ni nyan 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being intent on understanding the reality of what is to be known, one becomes desirous of listening.

original: nyan 'dod pa de la brten pas ni 'dri bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan 'dod pa de la brten pas ni 'dri bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By being desirous of listening, one becomes desirous of asking questions.

original: 'dri ba de la brten pas ni sngon ma thos pa'i don nyan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dri ba de la brten pas ni sngon ma thos pa'i don nyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being desirous of asking questions, one becomes desirous of listening to the meaning that has not been heard before.

original: yang dang yang du rtag tu mnyan pas ni de nyid rnam par byang ba dang / the tshom skyes pa las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rtag tu mnyan pas ni de nyid rnam par byang ba dang / the tshom skyes pa las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By listening again and again, one becomes purified of that and turns away from the arising of doubt.

original: de ltar blo rnam par byang bas ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi nyes dmigs mthong nas sems skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar blo rnam par byang bas ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi nyes dmigs mthong nas sems skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, with the mind purified, one becomes disenchanted with the world, seeing the faults of all worldly excellence.

original: de ltar sems skyo zhing dge ba yid la byed pa ni phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad la smon par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de de ltar 'jig rten pa'i mngon par mthong ba'i lam thams cad la yid kyis smon pa med pas /
analyzed: de ltar sems skyo zhing dge ba yid la byed pa ni phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad la smon par mi 'gyur ro // de de ltar 'jig rten pa'i mngon par mthong ba'i lam thams cad la yid kyis smon pa med pas /
translated: With the mind disenchanted, one does not aspire to any excellence, but attends to wholesome thoughts.

original: ngan song ba'i chos thams cad spang ba'i phyir yang sems kyis smon par byed la /
analyzed: ngan song ba'i chos thams cad spang ba'i phyir yang sems kyis smon par byed la /
translated: Thus, with the mind not aspiring to any excellence, one aspires to abandon all the qualities that lead to lower realms.

original: de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams @265b cad kyi gnyen po dge ba'i chos yang dag par blang ba dang / de'i gnyen po'i 'bras bu thob pas rang gi sems rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir yang sems kyis smon par byed do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams @265b cad kyi gnyen po dge ba'i chos yang dag par blang ba dang / de'i gnyen po'i 'bras bu thob pas rang gi sems rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir yang sems kyis smon par byed do //
translated: The remedy for that is the adoption of virtuous qualities, the adoption of virtuous qualities as the remedy for all the afflictions, and the attainment of the result of that remedy in order to purify one's mind.

original: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin par gyur pa nas /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin par gyur pa nas /
translated: By these ten aspects, the wisdom that matures the liberation becomes mature,

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i go rims bzhin du rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i go rims bzhin du rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and liberation becomes perfected in the order in which it is taught.

original: yan lag gsum po go rims bzhin du bstan pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag gsum po go rims bzhin du bstan pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: These three branches are taught in order:

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin par byed pa'i yan lag gsum po bstan pa'i don du gyur pa 'di dag rgyas par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin par byed pa'i yan lag gsum po bstan pa'i don du gyur pa 'di dag rgyas par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three branches of the cause of meditation are the cause of the perfection of listening to the holy Dharma, the cause of making nirvana primary, and the cause of the perfection of the wisdom that ripens complete liberation.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag yin par rig par bya ste /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag yin par rig par bya ste / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: These ten aspects should be understood as the branches of the cause of meditation.🔽There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: yan lag gsum po 'di dag nyid ni bsgom pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gsum po 'di dag nyid ni bsgom pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: These three branches are called the cause of meditation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar go rims la brten nas rgyu de dang rkyen des rnal 'byor bsgom par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar go rims la brten nas rgyu de dang rkyen des rnal 'byor bsgom par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because in this way, in dependence on the sequence, the cause and the condition, the meditation of the yogi is accomplished.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin par byed pa'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gtso bor byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin par byed pa'o / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: the perfection of listening to the holy Dharma, the priority of nirvana, and the perfection of the wisdom that ripens complete liberation.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditation on the counteragent?

original: mdor bsdu na gnas skabs gsum la rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu po 'di yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gnas skabs gsum la rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu po 'di yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be known that there are ten kinds of counteragents to the practice of yoga in three situations.

original: gnas skabs gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three situations?

original: khyim pa'i gnas skabs dang rab tu byung ba'i gnas skabs dang / rab tu dben par nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: khyim pa'i gnas skabs dang rab tu byung ba'i gnas skabs dang / rab tu dben par nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The situation of the householder, the situation of the renunciate, and the situation of the practice of yoga in solitary meditation.

original: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten counteragents to the practice of yoga?

original: khyim pa'i gnas skabs su bdag gi chung ma la 'khrig pa'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang / de ma yin pa'i g-yog 'khor gyi longs spyod dang ldan pa'i chags pa 'di ni /🔽khyim pa'i gnas skabs su gtogs pa'i @266a * //
analyzed: khyim pa'i gnas skabs su bdag gi chung ma la 'khrig pa'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang / de ma yin pa'i g-yog 'khor gyi longs spyod dang ldan pa'i chags pa 'di ni / khyim pa'i gnas skabs su gtogs pa'i @266a * //
translated: The attachment that is associated with the thought of sexual intercourse with one’s wife, and the attachment that is associated with the enjoyment of one’s retinue,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: are the adverse elements that pertain to the stage of a householder.

original: mngon par 'byung ba la thams cad kyi thams cad du gegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba la thams cad kyi thams cad du gegs byed pa'o //
translated: They are adverse elements because they are obstacles to going forth.

original: khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba yang rtog pa'i kun du 'khrug pa'i mngon par dga' ba'i gegs byed de /
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba yang rtog pa'i kun du 'khrug pa'i mngon par dga' ba'i gegs byed de /
translated: The delight in the turmoil of conceptual thoughts is an obstacle to going forth from home into homelessness.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di gnyis kyi gnyen po bsgom pa ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di gnyis kyi gnyen po bsgom pa ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the counteragents to these two adverse elements should be understood as being, respectively,

original: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽rab tu byung ba ni rab tu byung ba'i gnas skabs la gnas pa na /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o // rab tu byung ba ni rab tu byung ba'i gnas skabs la gnas pa na /
translated: the cultivation of the notion of the foul and the cultivation of the notion of impermanence.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: When one has gone forth, one should, in brief,

original: dus dus su bya ba rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: dus dus su bya ba rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four types of activities that occur from time to time.

original: ci bdag dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la rtag tu brtson pa la brten nas /
analyzed: ci bdag dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la rtag tu brtson pa la brten nas /
translated: What if I were to rely on constant effort in cultivating virtuous natures?

original: rnam par shes pa bde ba'i ro myang ba rjes su 'brang ba'i las ldog cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bde ba'i ro myang ba rjes su 'brang ba'i las ldog cing /
translated: Would I turn away from the karma that follows the experience of the taste of the pleasure of consciousness and🔽would I fully realize suffering just as it is?🔽What if I were to rely on constant effort in cultivating virtuous natures?🔽What if I were to rely on constant effort in cultivating virtuous natures?🔽What if I were to rely on constant effort in cultivating virtuous natures?

original: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la rtag tu brtson par bya ba la nyams bde bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes dus dus su grong dang grong rdal dag tu bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu bar bya ba dang / ci nas kyang bdag khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i 'du 'dzi sna tshogs la mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la rtag tu brtson par bya ba la nyams bde bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes dus dus su grong dang grong rdal dag tu bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu bar bya ba dang / ci nas kyang bdag khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i 'du 'dzi sna tshogs la mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: He should live in a secluded place, thinking, “I will not be distracted by the various activities of householders and renunciates,

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i nyan pa dang / lta ba dang / bkur sti bya ba rnams kyis yang dag par nges par rtog pa'i sems rtse gcig gi gnas skabs kyi bar chad byed par mi 'gyur bar bya'o zhes rab tu dben pa'i gnas su gnas pa ni de'i bya ba bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i nyan pa dang / lta ba dang / bkur sti bya ba rnams kyis yang dag par nges par rtog pa'i sems rtse gcig gi gnas skabs kyi bar chad byed par mi 'gyur bar bya'o zhes rab tu dben pa'i gnas su gnas pa ni de'i bya ba bzhi pa yin no //
translated: or by the various worldly conversations, or by the various activities of listening, looking, and paying respect, and I will not interrupt the state of one-pointed concentration of mind that is focused on the true nature.”

original: bya ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos kyang rnam pa bzhi kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bya ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos kyang rnam pa bzhi kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: The counteragents to these four activities should be understood as fourfold.

original: bya ba dang po'i snyom las dang le lo'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang po'i snyom las dang le lo'o //
translated: They are laziness and indolence, which are counteragents to the first activity;

original: bya ba gnyis pa'i ni 'jig @266b tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba gnyis pa'i ni 'jig @266b tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The second action is the view of the perishable collection.

original: bya ba gsum pa ni rol 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba gsum pa ni rol 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: The third action is the desire for play and passion.

original: bya ba bzhi pa ni 'jig rten pa rnam pa sna tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba bzhi pa ni 'jig rten pa rnam pa sna tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: The fourth action is the desire for passion and attachment to various worldly things.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi po de dag gi go rims bzhin du gnyen po bsgom pa yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi po de dag gi go rims bzhin du gnyen po bsgom pa yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the counteragents should be understood as fourfold, in accordance with the order of these four kinds of adverse elements.

original: mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o//
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o//
translated: One should cultivate the notion of impermanence, the notion of suffering in the impermanent, the notion of non-self in what is suffering, the notion of disgust towards food, and the notion of non-delight in the entire world.

original: de la rab tu dben par nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i rnal 'byor yid la 'jog pa'i gnas skabs la ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la rab tu dben par nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i rnal 'byor yid la 'jog pa'i gnas skabs la ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: In this regard, in the state of mental placement in the yoga of internal serenity through isolation, in brief,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: There are four kinds of things that are adverse to the four kinds of attention.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs la sems mun par gyur pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la ro myang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sred pa dang / skye ba la g-yo ba'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems dang / sang nas sang du bshol te dus gzhan la ltos shing mi 'chi ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i brtun par sbyor bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs la sems mun par gyur pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la ro myang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sred pa dang / skye ba la g-yo ba'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems dang / sang nas sang du bshol te dus gzhan la ltos shing mi 'chi ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i brtun par sbyor bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: The mind becomes dark in regard to the side of serenity and insight; craving follows as one tastes the meditative absorptions; the mind follows the signs of agitation in regard to rebirth; and one does not apply oneself with diligence, putting off until tomorrow and the next day, hoping for a future time and not for death.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi po de dag la yang gnyen po bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi po de dag la yang gnyen po bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: There are four kinds of meditation on the counteragents to those four adverse things.

original: snang ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa'o //
translated: They are meditation on the perception of light, meditation on the perception of freedom from desire, meditation on the perception of cessation, and meditation on the perception of death.

original: de la mi sdug pa'i 'du shes ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mi sdug pa'i 'du shes ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The idea of the foul is twofold:

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: that which is included in the power of analysis and that which is included in the power of meditation.

original: de la so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i mi sdug ba'i 'du shes ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i mi sdug ba'i 'du shes ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The idea of the foul that is included in the power of analysis is a dharma that is opposed to five kinds of things.

original: lnga gang zhe na /🔽ngon mthon du bud med dang nye bar gnas pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / lkog tu bag med par gnas pa dang / lkog tu yang rung /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / ngon mthon du bud med dang nye bar gnas pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / lkog tu bag med par gnas pa dang / lkog tu yang rung /
translated: What are the five?🔽They are:🔽1) dwelling in the presence of women,🔽2) forgetfulness,🔽3) secret and undisciplined dwelling,

original: ngon mthon du yang rung ste /
analyzed: ngon mthon du yang rung ste /
translated: 4) dwelling in the presence of those who are undisciplined,🔽5) confusion of attention.

original: sngon goms pa'i stobs dang / mi sdug pa bsgom pa la brtson na yang @267a * //🔽yid la byed pa 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i stobs dang / mi sdug pa bsgom pa la brtson na yang @267a * // yid la byed pa 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Even if one has the power of previous practice and is diligent in the meditation on the foul,🔽one is confused in one's attention.

original: de la yid la byed pa 'khrul pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa 'khrul pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the confusion of attention.

original: mi sdug pa de la so sor ma brtags pas sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: mi sdug pa de la so sor ma brtags pas sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: Because one does not analyze the foul, one follows the signs of the beautiful.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: The factors that are incompatible with the meditation on the impurity that is included in the power of meditation should be understood as being of seven types.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: bya ba ngan pas sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / bya ba ngan pa byed pa la 'jug pa dang / sri zhu med cing 'dri ba med pa la brten pas /
analyzed: bya ba ngan pas sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / bya ba ngan pa byed pa la 'jug pa dang / sri zhu med cing 'dri ba med pa la brten pas /
translated: The distraction of the mind by bad actions, the engagement in the performance of bad actions, and the lack of respect and lack of inquiry that are based on these.

original: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa la mi mkhas pa dang / dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa la brten pas dben pa na gnas kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pas sems dkrugs pa dang / kha zas kyi tshod ma zin pa la brten pas lus las su mi rung ba dang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa la mi mkhas pa dang / dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa la brten pas dben pa na gnas kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pas sems dkrugs pa dang / kha zas kyi tshod ma zin pa la brten pas lus las su mi rung ba dang /
translated: The lack of skill in the mental attention of yoga, the agitation of the mind by defiled thoughts, even when one is dwelling in solitude, due to the lack of restraint of the sense faculties, and the unserviceability of the body due to the lack of moderation in food.

original: rtog pas dkrugs pa de nyid la brten pas nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas rab tu dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / lus las su mi rung ba de nyid la brten pas lhag mthong la nyams bde ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pas dkrugs pa de nyid la brten pas nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas rab tu dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / lus las su mi rung ba de nyid la brten pas lhag mthong la nyams bde ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the unserviceability of the body, one does not have the bliss of insight.

original: shes bya la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog mi nus pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one is unable to discern correctly the knowable as it is.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag thams cad bsdus nas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag thams cad bsdus nas /
translated: All of these dharmas that are adverse elements are included in

original: rnam grangs bcu gnyis su yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs bcu gnyis su yang 'gyur ro //
translated: twelve categories.

original: rnam grangs bcu bzhir yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs bcu bzhir yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also included in fourteen categories.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag gi gnyen por dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos kyang de kho na rnyed yod de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag gi gnyen por dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos kyang de kho na rnyed yod de /
translated: The remedies for those adverse elements are the dharmas on the side of the bright, which are also included in those very categories.

original: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis pa'i gces spras byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis pa'i gces spras byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are the cultivation of the two kinds of perception of the foul.

original: de la mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnams ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnams ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The factors that are discordant with the recognition of suffering in relation to impermanence should be understood as six types.

original: drug gang zhe na /🔽dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams thog ma bskyed pa la snyom las byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnam pa gnas par bya ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams thog ma bskyed pa la snyom las byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnam pa gnas par bya ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba dang /
translated: What are the six?🔽Laziness in generating virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen, laziness in maintaining virtuous qualities that have arisen, laziness in preventing their degeneration, laziness in perfecting their cultivation, laziness in increasing them, and laziness in expanding them.

original: rgyas par bya ba la le lo byed pa dang / bla ma la sri zhu byed du 'gro ba dang / yongs su dri ba dag la rtag 'grus su mi byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos rtag tu bsgom pa la rtag 'grus @267b mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rgyas par bya ba la le lo byed pa dang / bla ma la sri zhu byed du 'gro ba dang / yongs su dri ba dag la rtag 'grus su mi byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos rtag tu bsgom pa la rtag 'grus @267b mi byed pa dang /
translated: Not being diligent in attending to and questioning the guru, not being diligent in always cultivating virtuous qualities,

original: bla ma la yid mi ches shing yid mi ches pa de la brten pas rtag 'grus mi byed pa dang / nang la bag med cing bag med pa de la brten pas dge ba'i chos rtag tu bsgom pa la rtag 'grus su mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma la yid mi ches shing yid mi ches pa de la brten pas rtag 'grus mi byed pa dang / nang la bag med cing bag med pa de la brten pas dge ba'i chos rtag tu bsgom pa la rtag 'grus su mi byed pa'o //
translated: He is not internally heedful, and because of that lack of heedfulness, he does not practice constantly in the cultivation of wholesome states.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos de dag gi gnyen por de dag las bzlog pa nyid kyi chos drug ni gces spras byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽snang ba'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos de dag gi gnyen por de dag las bzlog pa nyid kyi chos drug ni gces spras byed pa yin par rig par bya'o // snang ba'i 'du shes ni /
translated: The six qualities that are the opposites of those unfavorable qualities should be understood as the six excellences.🔽The perception of light

original: snang ba rnam pa du ma la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba rnam pa du ma la dmigs pa ste /
translated: is the perception of many kinds of light.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as it occurs in the stage of meditative concentration.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni chos snang ba la dmigs pa la snang ba'i 'du shes zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni chos snang ba la dmigs pa la snang ba'i 'du shes zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: In this context, however, the perception of light is the perception of the light of the Dharma.

original: de la ji ltar thos pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / khong du chud pa rnams la brjed ngas pa med pa ni chos rnams kyi chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar thos pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / khong du chud pa rnams la brjed ngas pa med pa ni chos rnams kyi chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of forgetfulness with regard to what has been heard, understood, and penetrated is called the light of the Dharma.

original: de dang 'grogs pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni snang ba'i 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'grogs pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni snang ba'i 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The perception of that and the perception associated with it should be known as the perception of light.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Because🔽one who is diligent in the aspect of serenity

original: zhi gnas kyi phyogs la brtson pa'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi phyogs la brtson pa'am /
translated: or one who is diligent in the aspect of insight,

original: lhag mthong gi phyogs la brtson pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i dran pa nyams pa de ni sems kyi mun pa yang dag pa yin la /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phyogs la brtson pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i dran pa nyams pa de ni sems kyi mun pa yang dag pa yin la /
translated: the loss of mindfulness that arises from the cause of Dharma is the true darkness of the mind.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi snang ba yang dag pa yin par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi snang ba yang dag pa yin par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The opposite of that should be known as the true absence of light.

original: de la bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: de la bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: The eleven factors that are adverse to the perception of light that is associated with the wisdom derived from hearing and the wisdom derived from meditation are as follows.

original: bcu gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eleven?

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes kyi ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes kyi ni bzhi'o //
translated: The four factors that are adverse to the perception of light that is associated with the wisdom derived from hearing are as follows.🔽The seven factors that are adverse to the perception of light that is associated with the wisdom derived from meditation are as follows.🔽The four factors that are adverse to the perception of light that is associated with the wisdom derived from meditation are as follows.🔽The four factors that are adverse to the perception of light that is associated with the wisdom derived from meditation are as follows.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos ni bdun te /🔽bsam pa'i ni shin tu ma brtags pa dang / gtan la ma phab pa'i phyir the tshom dang 'brel pa dang / mtshan mo gnas par khas 'ches la /🔽snyom las dang le los ha kyang gnyid la brten pas dus dus su bya ba don med par 'gyur ba dang / nyin par gnas par khas 'ches la /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos ni bdun te /🔽bsam pa'i ni shin tu ma brtags pa dang / gtan la ma phab pa'i phyir the tshom dang 'brel pa dang / mtshan mo gnas par khas 'ches la /🔽snyom las dang le los ha kyang gnyid la brten pas dus dus su bya ba don med par 'gyur ba dang / nyin par gnas par khas 'ches la /
