original: kha zas la brten nyes pas chos la nges par rtog pa dang mi mthun @268a * //
analyzed: kha zas la brten nyes pas chos la nges par rtog pa dang mi mthun @268a * //
translated: The Dharma is not understood because of the fault of relying on food,

original: pa lus las su mi rung ba dang / khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag dang 'dres par gyur pas /
analyzed: pa lus las su mi rung ba dang / khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag dang 'dres par gyur pas /
translated: the body is not fit for practice because of the fault of not being free from the household life,

original: ji ltar gnas pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / khong du chud pa'i chos rnams yid la mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / khong du chud pa'i chos rnams yid la mi byed pa ste /
translated: and the Dharma that has been learned and understood is not attended to because of the fault of not being free from society.

original: de ltar the tshom dang 'brel pa dang the tshom bsal ba'i rgyu la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos bzhi pa 'di dag ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes de las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par ma dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar the tshom dang 'brel pa dang the tshom bsal ba'i rgyu la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro // mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos bzhi pa 'di dag ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes de las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par ma dag par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of the connection with doubt and the hindrance to the cause of the removal of doubt.🔽These four qualities that are adverse are the cause of the impurity of the knowledge and insight that arises from the perception of light which is associated with the wisdom that arises from thinking.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma bsgoms pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma bsgoms pa las brtsams te /
translated: The four qualities that are favorable are the cause of the purity of the knowledge and insight that arises from the perception of light which is associated with the wisdom that arises from thinking.🔽What are the four?

original: ha cang brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / zhi gnas kyi mchan mal bsgoms pa las brtsams te /🔽brtson 'grus ha cang zhum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma bsgoms pa las brtsams te snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'i ros phrogs pas rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa'i shin tu dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pas skrag pa'i yid kyis de la gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bag tsha ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos gnyis dang /
analyzed: ha cang brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / zhi gnas kyi mchan mal bsgoms pa las brtsams te / brtson 'grus ha cang zhum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma bsgoms pa las brtsams te snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'i ros phrogs pas rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa'i shin tu dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pas skrag pa'i yid kyis de la gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bag tsha ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos gnyis dang /
translated: The two factors that are incompatible with the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment are: the excessive application of vigour in regard to adverse elements and the excessive laxity of vigour in regard to the counteragent, i.e. the meditative development of the signs of serenity.🔽The two factors that are incompatible with the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment are: the excessive delight that is associated with attachment because one is carried away by the relish of the taste of meditative concentration; and the anxiety that is associated with the harm of meditative concentration because of the fear of nirvana.

original: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa de nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa de nyid las brtsams te /
translated: The two factors that are incompatible with the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment are: the distraction of the mind that is associated with the mental attention to the spiritual levels of the śrāvaka and the pratyekabuddha; and the distraction of the mind that is associated with the mental attention to the spiritual levels of the śrāvaka and the pratyekabuddha.

original: 'bel ba'i chos kyi gtam gtan la 'bebs pa la zhugs pa'i rtsod pa dang / rgyun du ha cang smra ba mngas pa de yang nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i tshe bgegs byed pa dang / rtog pa ngan pa dag gis gzugs dang / sgra dang /
analyzed: 'bel ba'i chos kyi gtam gtan la 'bebs pa la zhugs pa'i rtsod pa dang / rgyun du ha cang smra ba mngas pa de yang nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i tshe bgegs byed pa dang / rtog pa ngan pa dag gis gzugs dang / sgra dang /
translated: (1) being distracted by the five sense objects, (2) being distracted by the five sense objects and the five hindrances, (3) being distracted by the five sense objects and the five hindrances and the seven factors of enlightenment, (4) being distracted by the five sense objects and the five hindrances and the seven factors of enlightenment and the noble eightfold path, (5) being distracted by the five sense objects and the five hindrances and the seven factors of enlightenment and the noble eightfold path and the four noble truths, (6) engaging in debate that is based on the ascertainment of the meaning of the Dharma, and (7) being distracted by excessive speech and by bad thoughts that apprehend forms, sounds,

original: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin pa mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su 'dzin cing /🔽sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la rtog pas chos rnams la ha cang brtags pa ste /
analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin pa mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su 'dzin cing / sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la rtog pas chos rnams la ha cang brtags pa ste /
translated: smells, tastes, and textures as signs and marks.

original: chos bdun po 'di dag ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes kyi bgegs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: chos bdun po 'di dag ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes kyi bgegs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: These seven factors are hindrances to the perception of light that is endowed with the wisdom arisen from meditation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos de dag gis bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes de las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par ma dag par byed do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos de dag gis bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i snang ba'i 'du shes de las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par ma dag par byed do //
translated: These factors that are adverse to the perfection of wisdom obscure the wisdom that arises from meditation and the knowledge that arises from the perception of light.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag @268b gi gnyen por de las bzlog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i chos kyang bcu gcig kho na yod de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag @268b gi gnyen por de las bzlog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i chos kyang bcu gcig kho na yod de /
translated: There are also eleven factors that are remedies for those adverse factors, which are the opposite of the adverse factors and eliminate them.

original: de las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they purify the knowledge that arises from the perception of light.

original: 'du shes thams cad bsgom pa la zhugs pa la ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba la 'dun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa dang du mi len cing spong ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po la shas cher gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad bsgom pa la zhugs pa la ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba la 'dun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa dang du mi len cing spong ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po la shas cher gnas pa ste /
translated: For one who has entered the cultivation of all perceptions, there is aspiration to abandon the adverse factors, not tolerating and abandoning the practice of adverse factors, and greatly abiding in their antidotes in order to conquer the adverse factors.

original: chos gsum po 'di dag ni gnyen po bsgom pa thams cad dang mthun pa'i phyir gces spras byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos gsum po 'di dag ni gnyen po bsgom pa thams cad dang mthun pa'i phyir gces spras byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These three dharmas are called “cherished” because they are in harmony with all the cultivations of counteragents.

original: 'di ni gnyen po bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyen po bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “cultivation of counteragents.”

original: gnyen por bsgom pa gang yin pa de nyid rnal 'byor bsgom pa yang yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen por bsgom pa gang yin pa de nyid rnal 'byor bsgom pa yang yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: That which is cultivation of counteragents should be regarded as cultivation of yoga.

original: yan lag lnga pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag lnga pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It has five branches:

original: gnyen po bsgom pa bstan pa'i don du gyur pa de'i rgyas pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa bstan pa'i don du gyur pa de'i rgyas pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The expansion of that is the following:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: rnam pa bcu ste /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ste / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: It has ten aspects:🔽There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purification of the mundane in all aspects?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be regarded as threefold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'o //
translated: attainment of concentration, perfection of concentration, and mastery of concentration.

original: de la thog ma kho nar ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag ni ting nge 'dzin mi 'thob par byed pa yin te /

translated: First, there are twenty factors that are incompatible with meditative concentration and prevent one from attaining it.🔽What are these twenty?

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: They are as follows:🔽(1) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(2) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(3) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(4) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.

original: slong ba las 'dun pa zlog par byed pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa grogs po'i nyes pa dang / grogs po'i yon tan yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: slong ba las 'dun pa zlog par byed pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa grogs po'i nyes pa dang / grogs po'i yon tan yod du zin kyang /
translated: (5) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(6) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(7) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(8) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.

translated: (9) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(10) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(11) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(12) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.🔽(13) One is unwilling to turn away from one’s desires and to give up one’s possessions.

analyzed: 'dun pa chung ba'i sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pas 'dzin mi nus pa'i nyes pa dang / nyan pa la rna ba blags pa yod du zin kyang /

original: blun zhing blo zhan pa'i phyir 'dzin mi nus pa'i nyes pa dang / shes pa'i yon tan yod du zin kyang ser sna spyod pas /
analyzed: blun zhing blo zhan pa'i phyir 'dzin mi nus pa'i nyes pa dang / shes pa'i yon tan yod du zin kyang ser sna spyod pas /
translated: The fault of being unable to retain the teachings because of being stupid and dull-witted.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i shas che ba'i nyes pa dang / mya @269a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i shas che ba'i nyes pa dang / mya @269a * //
translated: The fault of being greedy for gain and honor because of having the fault of stinginess even though one has the good qualities of knowledge.

original: ngan du bya ba mang ba gso dka' zhing dgang dka' bas chog mi shes pa'i nyes pa dang / de nyid dbang du byas te /
analyzed: ngan du bya ba mang ba gso dka' zhing dgang dka' bas chog mi shes pa'i nyes pa dang / de nyid dbang du byas te /
translated: The fault of being discontented because of being difficult to nourish and difficult to fill due to having many wants.🔽The fault of being lazy and indolent even though one is free of the above faults.

original: bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang snyom las dang le los sbyor ba khyad du gsod pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang /
analyzed: bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang snyom las dang le los sbyor ba khyad du gsod pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang /
translated: The fault of being arrogant even though one is free of the above faults.

original: gzhan las bgegs rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa med du zin kyang grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa med du zin kyang nga rgyal dang kun nas mnar sems kyi nyes pas man ngag nod par mi byed pa'i nyes pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan las bgegs rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa med du zin kyang grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa med du zin kyang nga rgyal dang kun nas mnar sems kyi nyes pas man ngag nod par mi byed pa'i nyes pa dang /
translated: the fault of not receiving the intimate instruction due to the fault of pride and complete affliction, even if one is not at fault,🔽the fault of wrongly conceiving the intimate instruction, even if one is not at fault,

original: nyes pa de med du zin kyang man ngag la log par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med de man ngag mnos su zin kyang brjed pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang /
analyzed: nyes pa de med du zin kyang man ngag la log par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med de man ngag mnos su zin kyang brjed pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang /
translated: the fault of forgetting the intimate instruction, even if one is not at fault,🔽the fault of associating with householders and renunciates, even if one is not at fault,

original: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i dag dang 'dre bar gnas pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang nyes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i gnas mal na gnas pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i dag dang 'dre bar gnas pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang nyes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i gnas mal na gnas pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: and the fault of remaining in a place with five faults, even if one is not at fault.

original: gnas mal gyi nyes pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi nyes pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five faults of a place are as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is explained in the Sravaka Levels.🔽There is no fault, because even though you are abiding in solitude, you may rely on a lack of self-control of the senses and so develop negative thoughts.

original: nyes pa med de rab tu dben pa na gnas su zin kyang dbang po ma brtags pa la brten nas rtog pa ngan pa 'byung ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang zas mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba lus lci zhing las su mi rung ba'i nyes pa dang /
analyzed: nyes pa med de rab tu dben pa na gnas su zin kyang dbang po ma brtags pa la brten nas rtog pa ngan pa 'byung ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang zas mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba lus lci zhing las su mi rung ba'i nyes pa dang /
translated: Even if you do not have that fault, you may have the fault of physical heaviness and unserviceability that arises from the cause of eating improper food.

original: nyes pa de med du zin kyang rang bzhin gyis gnyid che bas dus ma yin par gnyid kyi nyes pa'i nyon mongs pa shes cher kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang sngon zhi gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs spyod spyod pas /
analyzed: nyes pa de med du zin kyang rang bzhin gyis gnyid che bas dus ma yin par gnyid kyi nyes pa'i nyon mongs pa shes cher kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang sngon zhi gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs spyod spyod pas /
translated: Even if you do not have that fault, you may have the fault of excessive sleepiness that causes you to sleep at the wrong time.

original: nang gi sems zhi gnas rab tu dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang sngon lhag mthong ma yin par spyod spyod pas /
analyzed: nang gi sems zhi gnas rab tu dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes pa de med du zin kyang sngon lhag mthong ma yin par spyod spyod pas /
translated: Even if you do not have that fault, you may have the fault of not delighting in the inner mental state of solitude that is meditative serenity because you have previously engaged in activities that are not conducive to meditative serenity.🔽Even if you do not have that fault, you may have the fault of excessive discursiveness because you have previously engaged in activities that are not conducive to insight.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab chos la rnam par lta ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab chos la rnam par lta ba las brtsams te /
translated: It is the supreme wisdom that observes phenomena.🔽

original: chos la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtag pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: chos la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtag pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The fault of not delighting in the correct analysis of phenomena, beginning with the discernment of phenomena with special insight.

original: chos nyi shu po 'di dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi sems rtse gcig pa 'thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa @269b yin no //
analyzed: chos nyi shu po 'di dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi sems rtse gcig pa 'thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa @269b yin no //
translated: These twenty phenomena are adverse to the attainment of the one-pointed mind of serenity and insight.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: These twenty adverse phenomena are, in brief,

original: rnam pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin skye ba la bar du gcod par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin skye ba la bar du gcod par byed de /
translated: fourfold in their obstruction of the arising of concentration.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?🔽Lack of skill in the means of concentration,🔽not applying oneself at all,🔽misapplying oneself,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi thabs mi mkhas pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / log par sbyor bar byed pa dang / sbyor ba lhod pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi thabs mi mkhas pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / log par sbyor bar byed pa dang / sbyor ba lhod pa'o //
translated: and lax application.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'di dag gi gnyen por gyur pa'i chos kyang nyi shu kho na yod de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'di dag gi gnyen por gyur pa'i chos kyang nyi shu kho na yod de /
translated: There are just twenty qualities that are antidotes to the qualities that are discordant with meditative concentration.

original: de la bzlog pa las dkar po'i phyogs su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bzlog pa las dkar po'i phyogs su rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that the opposite of those is the side of virtue.

original: de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong pa la gces spras byed pa'i phyir myur ba myur bar yang dag par sems gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong pa la gces spras byed pa'i phyir myur ba myur bar yang dag par sems gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Because they are cherished for abandoning the discordant side, they quickly cause one to attain meditative concentration in which the mind is perfectly stabilized.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs thob pa la bya ste /
translated: Attaining meditative concentration means attaining access to the first meditative stabilization.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa dang mi mthun pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa dang mthun pa'i don 'di'i rgyas pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o // ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa dang mi mthun pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa dang mthun pa'i don 'di'i rgyas pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: It should be understood as being included in the stage of the unrestricted state.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation of the meaning of the discordant side and the concordant side with regard to attaining meditative concentration is as follows.

original: rnam pa nyi shu yin par rig par bya ste /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu yin par rig par bya ste / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: It should be understood as being of twenty types.🔽There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: 'dis ni thog mar 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dis ni thog mar 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
translated: This verse shows that one should begin by purifying all mundane aspects.

original: chos 'di pa'i gang zag gi ting nge 'dzin thob pa kun bshad cing legs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i gang zag gi ting nge 'dzin thob pa kun bshad cing legs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This explains and teaches the meditative stabilization of all the persons of this Dharma, beginning from the purification of all worldly aspects.

original: des de ltar ting nge 'dzin thob nas bye brag chung ngu ngan don tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: des de ltar ting nge 'dzin thob nas bye brag chung ngu ngan don tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin te /
translated: Having thus attained meditative stabilization, he does not hold that a mere little bit of distinction is enough.

original: gong du ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa dang / de nyid la yon tan du lta ba dang / gang don du gnyer ba dang / gang la yon tan du lta zhing 'dod pa de'i don du brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gong du ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa dang / de nyid la yon tan du lta ba dang / gang don du gnyer ba dang / gang la yon tan du lta zhing 'dod pa de'i don du brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas pa dang /
translated: He wishes to perfect meditative stabilization further, and he views it as a good quality. He applies himself to the goal of that which he seeks and views as a good quality, and he abides in the effort for that goal.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i ro myang ba dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spyod pas pham par byas pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir de dag gi phyir pham par byed mi nus pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i ro myang ba dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spyod pas pham par byas pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir de dag gi phyir pham par byed mi nus pa dang /
translated: They are not defeated by the afflictions associated with the enjoyment of form, since they are diligent in virtue and thus cannot be defeated by them.🔽They do not form any bonds with the vast realms that are the abodes for rebirth as pure gods.

original: rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye ba'i gnas rgya chen po rnams la kun du sbyor ba mi byed pa dang / dman pa la mos pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye ba'i gnas rgya chen po rnams la kun du sbyor ba mi byed pa dang / dman pa la mos pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: They are not discouraged, thinking,

original: bdag gis @270a * //🔽mi nus so snyam du 'dzin pa'i zhum pa med cing /
analyzed: bdag gis @270a * // mi nus so snyam du 'dzin pa'i zhum pa med cing /
translated: I cannot do this.

original: de de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa'i chos rnams la sems zhum pa med pas /
analyzed: de de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa'i chos rnams la sems zhum pa med pas /
translated: Thus, since their minds are not discouraged with regard to the phenomena that are the objects of their concentration,

original: sngon thos pa'i zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma de nyid rtag tu byed cing gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba des rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / de de ltar chos kyi mtshan ma'i rjes su 'jug pas snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan zhing ldang ba na mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las brtsams te dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: sngon thos pa'i zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma de nyid rtag tu byed cing gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba des rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / de de ltar chos kyi mtshan ma'i rjes su 'jug pas snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan zhing ldang ba na mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las brtsams te dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the signs of śamatha, signs of complete focus, and signs of equanimity that one has heard about in the past. It is to engage in the practice of constantly and respectfully applying oneself to those. It is to enter into meditative absorption by engaging in the signs of the Dharma in that way. It is to listen to the sacred Dharma in order to perfect one’s samādhi so as to attain swift superknowledge when one rises from meditative absorption.

original: de la brten nas dus dus su 'dri zhing yongs su 'dri bar byed pa dang / de ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la brten nas dus dus su 'dri zhing yongs su 'dri bar byed pa dang / de ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: It is to ask questions and to inquire from time to time on the basis of that. It is to ask questions and to inquire from time to time on the basis of that.

original: yang dag par brtson pas dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin du rtogs pa'i nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi lhag mthong gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtags pas gsal zhing ches 'od gsal ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par brtson pas dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin du rtogs pa'i nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi lhag mthong gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtags pas gsal zhing ches 'od gsal ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By right effort, one attains the joy of the inner mental calm of the realization of the concentration of the main part, and by the insight into the dharmas, one attains the clarity and great luminosity of the correct analysis of things as they are.

original: de tsam gyis na dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: By that much, one should know that one has entered into the concentration of the main part.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i don 'di'i rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i don 'di'i rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive meaning of the perfection of samadhi is as follows:

original: rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: It should be known to have eleven aspects.🔽There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: de'i dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
translated: One attains the main part of samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs su zin kyang de'i sems de ting nge 'dzin skye ba'i ro myang ba'i sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur cing yongs su ma dag yongs su ma byang ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs su zin kyang de'i sems de ting nge 'dzin skye ba'i ro myang ba'i sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur cing yongs su ma dag yongs su ma byang ste /
translated: He has not become completely pure and completely cleansed.

original: de nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag kun du spyad par mi bya ba'i phyir sems tshar gcad pa dang / sems yongs su gdul ba'i don du sems la dbang yod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par bya'o snyam nas gnas bzhi la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis so sor @270b rtog ste /
analyzed: de nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag kun du spyad par mi bya ba'i phyir sems tshar gcad pa dang / sems yongs su gdul ba'i don du sems la dbang yod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par bya'o snyam nas gnas bzhi la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis so sor @270b rtog ste /
translated: In order to not indulge in those secondary afflictions, he thinks, “I will subdue my mind and completely tame it so that I can have control over my mind and attain mastery of concentration.” He then analyzes the four abodes with twenty-two aspects.

original: cha lugs dang / spyod lam dang / tshul ngan pa khas len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims dam po khas len pa dang / dge ba bsgom pa la rtag tu brtson par bya bar khas len pa dang / sdug bsngal gang spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: cha lugs dang / spyod lam dang / tshul ngan pa khas len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims dam po khas len pa dang / dge ba bsgom pa la rtag tu brtson par bya bar khas len pa dang / sdug bsngal gang spang ba'i phyir /
translated: the acceptance of bad behavior, the acceptance of bad morality, the acceptance of the practice of virtue, and the acceptance of the abandonment of suffering.

original: gnas gsum po 'di dag khas len pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid 'brel par so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gsum po 'di dag khas len pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid 'brel par so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: The suffering that is related to the acceptance of these three things is the discernment of each one.

original: skra dang kha spu bregs shing skra la sogs pa khyim pa'i mtshan ma rnams spangs pa dang / bdag nyid kyi gos kha dog bsgyur ba bgos pa'i phyir gzugs ngan par so sor rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni cha lugs ngan pa khas len pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs shing skra la sogs pa khyim pa'i mtshan ma rnams spangs pa dang / bdag nyid kyi gos kha dog bsgyur ba bgos pa'i phyir gzugs ngan par so sor rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni cha lugs ngan pa khas len pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The discernment of bad appearance is the discernment of the bad appearance of one who has shaved off his hair and beard and abandoned the householder's marks, and who has put on the saffron-colored robe. This is the discernment of the acceptance of bad appearance.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / smra ba rnams la dga' dgur spyod du med pa dang / nga rgyal bcom pa dang / gzhan gyi khyim du bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba la so sor rtog pa 'di ni spyod lam ngan pa khas len pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / smra ba rnams la dga' dgur spyod du med pa dang / nga rgyal bcom pa dang / gzhan gyi khyim du bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba la so sor rtog pa 'di ni spyod lam ngan pa khas len pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: He is not free to do as he pleases in walking, standing, sitting, lying down, or speaking. He has destroyed pride. He is discerning in going to other’s houses for alms.

original: pha rol las rnyed pa la sogs par mi byed pas srog gzungs la so sor rtog pa 'di ni /
analyzed: pha rol las rnyed pa la sogs par mi byed pas srog gzungs la so sor rtog pa 'di ni /
translated: He is discerning in not holding life dear.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa khas len pa la so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa khas len pa la so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: He is discerning in not accepting bad morality.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ni gnas dang po la so sor rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ni gnas dang po la so sor rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these five aspects should be understood the discernment of the first station.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba 'di ni mdor bsdu na dngos po rnam pa gnyis yongs su btang bas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba 'di ni mdor bsdu na dngos po rnam pa gnyis yongs su btang bas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: The morality of the religious life, which is well-spoken and belongs to the spiritual system of the Buddha, is, in brief, distinguished by the relinquishment of two things:

original: pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs dang / nor dang / 'bru dang /
analyzed: pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs dang / nor dang / 'bru dang /
translated: parents, children, spouses, male and female servants, workers, hired persons, friends, advisors, near and dear, elders, wealth, grain,

original: dbyig la sogs pa 'dod pa rnams yongs su gtang bas rab tu phye ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' dgur spyad pa dang / dgod pa dang / 'phyas 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: dbyig la sogs pa 'dod pa rnams yongs su gtang bas rab tu phye ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' dgur spyad pa dang / dgod pa dang / 'phyas 'dogs pa dang /
translated: gold, and so on. He is distinguished by giving up singing, dancing, music, laughter, play, enjoyment, amusement, and jesting.

original: lus bsgyur ba dang / kun du rtses pa dang / kun du ca co bton pa dang / rtsed mo'i dga' ba rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su btang bas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: lus bsgyur ba dang / kun du rtses pa dang / kun du ca co bton pa dang / rtsed mo'i dga' ba rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su btang bas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: He is distinguished by giving up the various kinds of fun and games, by giving up the various kinds of amusements, and by giving up the various kinds of enjoyments.

original: de de ltar tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pa na /
translated: “When he is thus established in the vow of morality,

original: tshul khrims nyams pa las brtsams te /🔽lkog tu bdag @271a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa las brtsams te / lkog tu bdag @271a * //
translated: he should not, on account of the degeneration of morality,

original: nyid la smod pa med pa /
analyzed: nyid la smod pa med pa /
translated: conceal his own faults in private.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis kyang 'di ltar 'di ni tshul khrims nyams pa yin no zhes chos nyid kyis rnam par smod par mi byed cing de la gleng bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis kyang 'di ltar 'di ni tshul khrims nyams pa yin no zhes chos nyid kyis rnam par smod par mi byed cing de la gleng bar yang mi byed do //
translated: And the fellow practitioners of pure conduct do not, in accordance with the Dharma, reproach him, saying, “You have violated your morality,” nor do they bring up the matter.

original: gal te des tshul khrims nyams par byas na yang gzhi de las de bdag nyid kyang smod par byed la /
analyzed: gal te des tshul khrims nyams par byas na yang gzhi de las de bdag nyid kyang smod par byed la /
translated: And if he does violate his morality, he reproaches himself on that basis.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis kyang chos nyid kyis rnam par smod par byed do //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis kyang chos nyid kyis rnam par smod par byed do //
translated: And the fellow practitioners of pure conduct, in accordance with the Dharma, reproach him.

original: de nas nyes pa de las chos bzhin du gnyen po bya ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gleng bar byed pa de dag la yang kun nas mnar sems med pas bdag nyid ma snad ma smas par yongs su 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: de nas nyes pa de las chos bzhin du gnyen po bya ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gleng bar byed pa de dag la yang kun nas mnar sems med pas bdag nyid ma snad ma smas par yongs su 'dren par byed do //
translated: Then, without any malice, he leads them to act in accordance with the Dharma to remedy that fault and to bring up the matter of the fellow practitioners of pure conduct. He does this without injuring himself or harming others.

original: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni gnas gnyis pa la so sor rtog go //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni gnas gnyis pa la so sor rtog go //
translated: In these five ways, he examines the second station.

original: de de ltar tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: de de ltar tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur na /
translated: When he has become moral in this way,

original: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnam pa lnga kho na la brtson par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnam pa lnga kho na la brtson par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that one is diligent in just five kinds of practices that are virtuous.

original: dus dus su man ngag nod pa dang / kha thon byed pa dang / 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pas pha rol dad pas byin pa la longs spyod par byed ba dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' zhing rnal 'byor yid la byed pa la goms pa dang nyin mtshan du nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang /
analyzed: dus dus su man ngag nod pa dang / kha thon byed pa dang / 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pas pha rol dad pas byin pa la longs spyod par byed ba dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' zhing rnal 'byor yid la byed pa la goms pa dang nyin mtshan du nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang /
translated: One enjoys the gifts of faith of others by being diligent in the virtuous practices of receiving instructions from time to time, reciting them, and resolving them through discussion; one is accustomed to delighting in solitude and to the mental orientation of yoga; and one understands and abandons the two kinds of things that are conducive to diminution and the two kinds of things that are conducive to enhancement.🔽One understands the two kinds of things that are conducive to diminution and the two kinds of things that are conducive to enhancement, and one abandons and cultivates them respectively.

original: khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos gnyis yongs su shes nas sprong zhing so sor bsten pa dang / 'khor ba la nyes par lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du lta ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos gnyis yongs su shes nas sprong zhing so sor bsten pa dang / 'khor ba la nyes par lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du lta ba ste /
translated: One views samsara as a fault and nirvana as a good quality.

original: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni gnas gsum pa la so sor rtog go //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni gnas gsum pa la so sor rtog go //
translated: By means of these five aspects, one examines the third abode.

original: gal te de ltar brtson du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar brtson du zin kyang /
translated: Even if one is diligent in this way,

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi dang 'brel te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi dang 'brel te /
translated: it is related to four kinds of suffering.🔽It is related to the suffering of the unfortunate realms because it has not attained any of the four fruits of the religious life.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las gang yang rung ba ma thob pas ngan song gi sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las gang yang rung ba ma thob pas ngan song gi sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas /
translated: It is related to the suffering of change because it is subject to birth, old age, sickness, and death.🔽It is related to the suffering of suffering because it is subject to the suffering of being separated from what is pleasant and encountering what is unpleasant.

original: nang rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang / sdug pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos can yin pas sdug pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang / las bdag gir bya ba yin par sdug @271b bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: nang rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang / sdug pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos can yin pas sdug pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang / las bdag gir bya ba yin par sdug @271b bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: It is related to the cause of all suffering because it is subject to karma.

original: de de ltar sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi dang 'brel pa la /
analyzed: de de ltar sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi dang 'brel pa la /
translated: In this way, it is related to four kinds of suffering.

original: rnam pa bdun gyis so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyis so sor rtog ste /
translated: It is analyzed in seven ways.

original: rnam pa bdun po 'di dag gis gnas bzhi pa de la so sor rtog go //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun po 'di dag gis gnas bzhi pa de la so sor rtog go //
translated: These seven kinds of analysis are applied to the fourth station.

original: de gnas bzhi po de dag la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po de dag gis so sor rtog pa na /
analyzed: de gnas bzhi po de dag la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po de dag gis so sor rtog pa na /
translated: When one examines each of these four abodes with these twenty two aspects,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'di ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'di ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: this proper attention arises:

original: ji ltar na bdag sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag las yongs su thar bar 'gyur zhig gu snyam ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag las yongs su thar bar 'gyur zhig gu snyam ste /
translated: “How can I be completely freed from these four kinds of suffering?”

original: de'i phyir bdag gi cha byad dang / spyod lam dang tshul ngan pa yang khas blangs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi cha byad dang / spyod lam dang tshul ngan pa yang khas blangs la /
translated: Therefore, I have accepted my own appearance, behavior, and bad conduct.

original: tshul khrims dang / tshul dang po yang khas blangs /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / tshul dang po yang khas blangs /
translated: I have also accepted morality and good conduct.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgoms pa la rtag tu brtson par bya ba la yang khas blangs na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgoms pa la rtag tu brtson par bya ba la yang khas blangs na /
translated: I have also accepted constant striving in the cultivation of virtuous qualities.

original: bdag gis so sor brtags shing brtags shing gnas gsum po 'di dag khas blangs bzhin du sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag dang 'brel pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag gis so sor brtags shing brtags shing gnas gsum po 'di dag khas blangs bzhin du sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag dang 'brel pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: But, having examined and examined these three abodes, I have only become bound to these four kinds of suffering,

original: yongs su ma grol te /
analyzed: yongs su ma grol te /
translated: and I have not been completely freed.

original: bdag 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la dbang ma thob pas sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la dbang ma thob pas sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Since I have not attained mastery over concentration, I will only be connected with suffering.

original: bar ma dor zhum pa gang yin pa 'di ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: bar ma dor zhum pa gang yin pa 'di ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam ste /
translated: This kind of slackness in the middle is not my style.

original: de ltar tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la brtson pa de'i rab tu byung ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni dge sbyong gi 'du shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la brtson pa de'i rab tu byung ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni dge sbyong gi 'du shes zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the perception of going forth that one who is striving in proper mental attention has is called the perception of a spiritual practitioner.

original: de'i 'du shes de ni bsgom pa shas cher byed pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'du shes de ni bsgom pa shas cher byed pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That perception of his becomes complete through the method of cultivating it to a high degree.

original: de de la brten nas des 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa des /
analyzed: de de la brten nas des 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa des /
translated: On the basis of that, he attains the perfection of concentration through the mundane path.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon sum du ma byas pa de la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon sum du ma byas pa de la /
translated: He does not manifest the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: spong ba la kun du dga' ba las brtsams nas rtag tu byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spong ba la kun du dga' ba las brtsams nas rtag tu byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is always engaged in that, beginning with delight in abandonment.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la kun du dga' ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la kun du dga' ba las brtsams te /
translated: He cultivates the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment in order to attain mastery of the meditative concentrations.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam dge ba thob pa de nyid la yang dang yang rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam dge ba thob pa de nyid la yang dang yang rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: He constantly and always engages in the attainment of the mundane virtues.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byed cing /🔽rnyed pa chen po dag bstabs na yang /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byed cing / rnyed pa chen po dag bstabs na yang /
translated: He is honoured by brahmins and householders who have faith🔽and he is offered great gain.🔽He does not generate covetousness in regard to that gain and honour.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti de dag las brtsams te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti de dag las brtsams te /
translated: He does not generate covetousness in regard to the gain and honour of others.

original: brnab sems mi bskyed la /🔽gzhan dag gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang @272a * //🔽brnab sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: brnab sems mi bskyed la / gzhan dag gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang @272a * // brnab sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He does not generate malice in regard to those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.

original: pha rol ma dad pa rnams kyis mngon sum du yang rung /🔽lkog tu yang rung ste /
analyzed: pha rol ma dad pa rnams kyis mngon sum du yang rung / lkog tu yang rung ste /
translated: He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.🔽He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.

original: lus kyi las mi sdug pa dang / ngag gi las mi sdug pa kun du spyad pa na yang /
analyzed: lus kyi las mi sdug pa dang / ngag gi las mi sdug pa kun du spyad pa na yang /
translated: He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful and those who are not faithful.

original: sems kyis sdang bar mi byed cing /🔽sems kyi gnod sems dang ldan par mi byed do //
analyzed: sems kyis sdang bar mi byed cing /🔽sems kyi gnod sems dang ldan par mi byed do //
translated: He does not generate malice in regard to those who are faithful

original: sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kun du mi spyad par bya ba'i phyir yang dran pa shin tu brtan par gnas so //
analyzed: sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kun du mi spyad par bya ba'i phyir yang dran pa shin tu brtan par gnas so //
translated: He is also firmly mindful in order to avoid the various subsidiary defilements of craving, conceit, false view, ignorance, doubt, and meditative absorption.

original: zhi gnas rgya chen po thob tu zin kyang /
analyzed: zhi gnas rgya chen po thob tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though he has attained vast tranquility,

original: zhi gnas de kho na tsam gyis bdag nyid bya ba byas par mi 'dzin la pha rol dag la yang shes pa brda sprod par mi byed do //
analyzed: zhi gnas de kho na tsam gyis bdag nyid bya ba byas par mi 'dzin la pha rol dag la yang shes pa brda sprod par mi byed do //
translated: he does not consider himself to have done his duty merely by that tranquility, nor does he teach it to others.

original: de de ltar spong ba la dga' zhing bsgom pa la dga' bas /
analyzed: de de ltar spong ba la dga' zhing bsgom pa la dga' bas /
translated: Thus, delighting in abandonment and delighting in cultivation,

original: brnab sems med cing sems gnod sems dang ldan pa med de /
analyzed: brnab sems med cing sems gnod sems dang ldan pa med de /
translated: he is without covetousness and without ill will.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ldan zhing nga rgyal med la /🔽chos gos ngan ngon cam gyis chog shes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ldan zhing nga rgyal med la / chos gos ngan ngon cam gyis chog shes te /
translated: He is endowed with right mindfulness and without conceit.🔽He is satisfied with just the bare necessities of a monk’s robe,

original: chos gos la ji lta ba bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos gos la ji lta ba bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: just as he is with alms food, a seat, and medicine.

original: de ltar mgu zhing chog shes pa de 'di ltar yang dag par zhugs pas ting nge 'dzin la 'tsho ba'i yo byad 'di dag ni lus gnas par bya ba dang / srog gzungs dang / bkres pa zhi bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i bar gyi phyir shes bzhin du longs spyad pa nas /🔽rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar mgu zhing chog shes pa de 'di ltar yang dag par zhugs pas ting nge 'dzin la 'tsho ba'i yo byad 'di dag ni lus gnas par bya ba dang / srog gzungs dang / bkres pa zhi bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i bar gyi phyir shes bzhin du longs spyad pa nas / rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, being satisfied and content, he correctly engages in these requisites for the life of concentration, knowing that they are for the sake of maintaining the body, preserving life, and alleviating hunger, up to benefiting pure conduct.

original: kha zas kyi tshod rig pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kha zas kyi tshod rig pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: In detail, it is as found in the context of knowing the proper amount of food.

original: de de ltar yang dag par zhugs pas ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar yang dag par zhugs pas ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by correctly engaging in this way, he attains mastery over concentration.

original: de la gnas pas de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / skyon med pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nas rgyas par mi g-yo ba'i bar du thob na /
analyzed: de la gnas pas de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / skyon med pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nas rgyas par mi g-yo ba'i bar du thob na /
translated: Dwelling in that, he attains a mind that is thus completely purified, completely cleansed, faultless, free from afflictive emotions, up to unshakable.

original: de ma thag tu mngon par shes pa lnga bsgrub pa dang / zag pa zad pa bsgrub pa la mthu yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu mngon par shes pa lnga bsgrub pa dang / zag pa zad pa bsgrub pa la mthu yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately, one becomes capable of achieving the five superknowledges and the destruction of the contaminants.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba zhes bya'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i don 'di'i rgyas par ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba zhes bya'o // ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i don 'di'i rgyas par ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is called mastery of concentration.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of mastery of concentration should be understood in detail as follows:

original: 'di las gong na yang med do//
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do//
translated: There is nothing higher than this,

original: @272b 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: @272b 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: there is nothing greater than this.

original: dang po'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa gang yin pa dang / bar gyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: dang po'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa gang yin pa dang / bar gyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: Whatever is the attainment of the first concentration, whatever is the completion of the intermediate concentration, and whatever is mastery of concentration,

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa'i dag pa bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa'i dag pa bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: all of that is called the unsurpassed purity of the mundane.

original: de yang chos 'di pa'i yin par blta'i /
analyzed: de yang chos 'di pa'i yin par blta'i /
translated: And that should be seen as belonging to those who follow this Dharma,

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: not to those outside this Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane, pure aspect?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood as fivefold.

original: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /🔽bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa rnam par spang ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na / bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa rnam par spang ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: What are the five aspects?

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lam 'bras bu dang phan yon du bcas pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lam 'bras bu dang phan yon du bcas pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: They are: the realization of the truths, the abandonment of the practice of the truths, the mental attention to the things of supreme joy in order to have rapid superknowledge, the teaching of the path of meditation, and the acquisition of the path of purification together with its fruit and qualities.

original: de la bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the realization of the truths?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa dag la brtson zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa dag la brtson zhing /
translated: It is the realization of the truths by the disciples of the Tathāgatas who are intent on the mundane aspects.

original: yun ring po nas 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi kha zas kyis nye bar ston pa'i tshul du sems gsos la /
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi kha zas kyis nye bar ston pa'i tshul du sems gsos la /
translated: For a long time, they have nourished themselves with the food of the five worldly pleasures.

original: de dag nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis bltas par byas pa las 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs su lta zhing /
analyzed: de dag nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis bltas par byas pa las 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs su lta zhing /
translated: By looking at them with a sense of delight, one sees the faults of desire.

original: gong du zhi bar lta bas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gong du zhi bar lta bas 'di lta ste /
translated: By looking at the higher realms, one sees peace.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la spro ba dang bcas pa'i khams su rnam par gzhag pa ni sla'i //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la spro ba dang bcas pa'i khams su rnam par gzhag pa ni sla'i //
translated: It is easy to establish the realm of those who delight in the purification of the world in all its aspects.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i khams su rnam par gzhag pa ni dka'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i khams su rnam par gzhag pa ni dka'o //
translated: But it is difficult to establish the realm of those who are beyond the world and who are free of conceptual elaboration.

original: de yang skyo bzhin du gnas kyi /
analyzed: de yang skyo bzhin du gnas kyi /
translated: Moreover, one abides in a state of disenchantment,

original: skyo ba med pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyo ba med pas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in a state of non-disenchantment.

original: de la chos 'di pa mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa la sems rnam par gzhag par 'dod cing /
analyzed: de la chos 'di pa mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa la sems rnam par gzhag par 'dod cing /
translated: One who wishes to establish the mind in this Dharma, which is the peace that is free of conceptual elaboration,

original: mos par 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: mos par 'dod pa de ni /
translated: and who wishes to have conviction in it,

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: will, in the absence of the attainment of the fruits of the spiritual life,

original: bdag nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yang sems skyo ba skye zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yang sems skyo ba skye zhing /
translated: give rise to a disenchanted mind because of being afflicted with afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i phyir yang sems skyo ba skye la /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i nyes dmigs dang / rnam par byang ba dang bral @273a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i phyir yang sems skyo ba skye la / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i nyes dmigs dang / rnam par byang ba dang bral @273a * //
translated: One becomes weary of mind because of being separated from purification.

original: ba'i nyes dmigs dang / rnam par byang ba bsgrub pa dka' bar mthong ba'i phyir yang skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i nyes dmigs dang / rnam par byang ba bsgrub pa dka' bar mthong ba'i phyir yang skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes weary because of seeing the disadvantage of being associated with the defilements, the disadvantage of being separated from purification, and the difficulty of achieving purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /🔽ma byang ba dang / ma dul ba 'chi ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du shi nas kyang phyi ma la yang nyon mongs pa'i g-yangs chen por ltung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas ni mi dge ba'i chos kun du spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste / ma byang ba dang / ma dul ba 'chi ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du shi nas kyang phyi ma la yang nyon mongs pa'i g-yangs chen por ltung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas ni mi dge ba'i chos kun du spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, being associated with the defilements is threefold in brief:🔽being associated with the defilement of death, which is unpurified and undisciplined;🔽being associated with the defilement of falling into the great abyss of the defilements in the next life after death;

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: and being associated with the defilement of going to a place of fear because of being subject to the defilements and thus engaging in non-virtuous dharmas.

original: bdag nyid dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa med par yang dag par mthong la /
analyzed: bdag nyid dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa med par yang dag par mthong la /
translated: He sees that he himself does not have the attainment of the fruit of the sramana.

original: de med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa rnam pa de gsum yang dag par mthong bas yid skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa rnam pa de gsum yang dag par mthong bas yid skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of that, he sees that he himself does not have the three kinds of possession of defilement, and his mind becomes weary.

original: de la rnam par byang ba dang bral ba ni rnam pa gsum kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par byang ba dang bral ba ni rnam pa gsum kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the lack of purification should be understood as threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'jigs pa med pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / de thob par bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa las brtsams te dge ba'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas yang dag pa'i lta bar gtogs pa'i lam gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'jigs pa med pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / de thob par bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa las brtsams te dge ba'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas yang dag pa'i lta bar gtogs pa'i lam gyi mchog ste /
translated: the side of fear, which is nirvana, the abandonment of the defilements; the supreme path, which is the concentration of the virtuous mind that begins with the training in the higher mind, and the supreme path that is included in right view, which begins with the training in the higher insight.

original: de ltar bdag nyid rnam par byang ba rnam pa de gsum dang bral bar yang dag par mthong nas yid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid rnam par byang ba rnam pa de gsum dang bral bar yang dag par mthong nas yid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, seeing that he himself does not have these three kinds of purification, his mind becomes weary.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The disadvantages of being associated with the addictions should also be understood in three ways:

original: skye ba ni rga ba dang na ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dang / mi khom par skye ba dang / skye ba thams cad kyang mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni rga ba dang na ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dang / mi khom par skye ba dang / skye ba thams cad kyang mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The disadvantage of being associated with the addictions by nature is that birth is the root of the sufferings of aging and death. The disadvantage of being associated with the addictions by condition is that one is born in an unfavorable situation. The disadvantage of being associated with the addictions by continuity is that all births are connected with impermanence.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i nyes pa rigs gsum po 'di dag gis bdag nyid yid skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i nyes pa rigs gsum po 'di dag gis bdag nyid yid skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes disgusted with oneself because of these three kinds of disadvantages of being associated with the addictions.

original: rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i nyes dmigs ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i nyes dmigs ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The disadvantages of being separated from purification should be understood in five ways:

original: yul mtha' 'khob tu skye ba'i sgrib pa dang / ngan song du skye ba'i sgrib pa dang / khyim pa'i phyogs kyi mtshams med pa'i las kyi chu lon mi byed pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi lta bar gyur pa tshad med pa dang @273b ma bral ba dang /
analyzed: yul mtha' 'khob tu skye ba'i sgrib pa dang / ngan song du skye ba'i sgrib pa dang / khyim pa'i phyogs kyi mtshams med pa'i las kyi chu lon mi byed pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi lta bar gyur pa tshad med pa dang @273b ma bral ba dang /
translated: the obscuration to being born in a border region, the obscuration to being born in the lower realms, the non-performance of the deeds of the lay person that are like a dam, and the non-abandonment of the immeasurable views of the ordained person.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mo man chad du snyoms par zhugs shing skyes kyang thog ma med pa'i skye ba'i 'khor ba'i mthar thug par byed mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mo man chad du snyoms par zhugs shing skyes kyang thog ma med pa'i skye ba'i 'khor ba'i mthar thug par byed mi nus pa ste /
translated: Even though one enters into and is born in the meditative absorptions of the mundane path down to the peak of existence, one is still unable to bring about the end of saṃsāra, which has had no beginning.

original: rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa lnga po 'di dag lta bur yang dag par mthong nas bdag nyid yid skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa lnga po 'di dag lta bur yang dag par mthong nas bdag nyid yid skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen these five kinds of disadvantages of being devoid of purification, one becomes disenchanted with oneself.

original: de la rnam par byang ba bsgrub par dka' ba ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par byang ba bsgrub par dka' ba ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The difficulty of accomplishing purification should be understood in five ways.

original: mi byed cing yal bar bor bas byed mi nus pa dang / gzhan gyi don la gzhan gyis gzhan la bcol ba la brten pas bsgrub tu mi rung ba dang / gang gi phyir de ma byas kyi bar du bdag gi sems kyi rnam par byang ba de la sdug bsngal las grol bar 'gyur ba'i bde legs kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de mi byar mi rung ba dang /🔽sdig pa'i las rnams tshe 'di la ma byas pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis rnam par byang ba de byas par mi chud de /
analyzed: mi byed cing yal bar bor bas byed mi nus pa dang / gzhan gyi don la gzhan gyis gzhan la bcol ba la brten pas bsgrub tu mi rung ba dang / gang gi phyir de ma byas kyi bar du bdag gi sems kyi rnam par byang ba de la sdug bsngal las grol bar 'gyur ba'i bde legs kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de mi byar mi rung ba dang / sdig pa'i las rnams tshe 'di la ma byas pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis rnam par byang ba de byas par mi chud de /
translated: It is not right to not do it and to let it go, because it cannot be done. It is not right to not do it and to let it go, because it is not suitable to accomplish it by relying on others being appointed by others to do it for you. It is not right to not do it and to let it go, because until you do it, you do not have the nature of the excellence of happiness that is free from suffering, which is the purification of your mind.🔽It is not right to not do it and to let it go, because the extent to which you have purified yourself of nonvirtuous karma in this life is not the extent to which you have purified yourself of nonvirtuous karma that you have previously committed.

original: tshe 'di la de'i gnyen po'i lam rims nad med pa thob par ma gyur gyi bar du sngon byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam thob pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la de'i gnyen po'i lam rims nad med pa thob par ma gyur gyi bar du sngon byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam thob pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Purification is distinguished by the attainment of the path that is the antidote to that karma, but until you attain the absence of illness, you have not purified yourself of previously committed nonvirtuous karma.

original: des rnam pa lnga po 'di dag lta bur rnam par byad ba bsgrub dka' bar yang dag par mthong nas yid skyo ba skye zhing yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtan por rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: des rnam pa lnga po 'di dag lta bur rnam par byad ba bsgrub dka' bar yang dag par mthong nas yid skyo ba skye zhing yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtan por rtsom par byed do //
translated: Having seen these five aspects as difficult to accomplish, he generates a sense of urgency and undertakes firm effort to accomplish them.

original: des kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa dang bral ba mthong bas yid de skyo bar byed cing /
analyzed: des kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa dang bral ba mthong bas yid de skyo bar byed cing /
translated: Having seen the connection with defilement and the disconnection from purification, he generates a sense of urgency about that mind.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas skrag la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang bral ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas skrag la /
translated: Having seen the disadvantage of the connection with defilement and the disconnection from purification, he becomes afraid.

original: rnam par byang ba yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba la snyom las dang le lo las phyir ldog par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba la snyom las dang le lo las phyir ldog par byed do //
translated: He turns away from laziness and procrastination in accomplishing purification and abandoning defilement.

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa des ni yid de skyo bar byed la rnam par byas pa de lan mang du byas pas ni shin tu skyo bar byed do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa des ni yid de skyo bar byed la rnam par byas pa de lan mang du byas pas ni shin tu skyo bar byed do //
translated: By that aspect of attention, he generates a sense of urgency about that mind. By frequently doing that, he generates a strong sense of urgency.

original: skyo bar byed pa dang / shin tu skyo bar byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: skyo bar byed pa dang / shin tu skyo bar byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as there is weariness and great weariness,

original: skrag pa dang / shin tu skrag pa dang / phyir ldog pa dang / shin tu phyir ldog pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skrag pa dang / shin tu skrag pa dang / phyir ldog pa dang / shin tu phyir ldog pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so too there is fear, great fear, turning away, and great turning away.

original: de ltar de'i sems de skyo ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes @274a * //
analyzed: de ltar de'i sems de skyo ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes @274a * //
translated: Thus, his mind, endowed with the perception of weariness,

original: yid la byed pa'i gnas lngar gtogs pa dang / rnam pa nyi shu po de dag gis shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas nas /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i gnas lngar gtogs pa dang / rnam pa nyi shu po de dag gis shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas nas /
translated: having been thoroughly purified by these twenty aspects that pertain to the five topics of meditation,

original: rnam pa nyi shus yongs su zin pa'i rgyu rnam pa lnga po gzhan dag gis sred pa zad pa 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la myur ba myur bar sems yang dag par gnas shing yongs su yi chad ba'i phyir yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus yongs su zin pa'i rgyu rnam pa lnga po gzhan dag gis sred pa zad pa 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la myur ba myur bar sems yang dag par gnas shing yongs su yi chad ba'i phyir yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la
translated: quickly settles down in the cessation that is the extinction of craving, in nirvāṇa, and his mind does not turn away from it because of complete disenchantment.

original: / bdag gi bdag gang yang med do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: / bdag gi bdag gang yang med do snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks, “There is no self at all in the self.”

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five causes?

original: yid la byed pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: They are the realizations of the mental attentions.

original: yid la byed pa rtogs pa de'i mjug thogs su yang dag pa nyid du skyon med par 'jug cing /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rtogs pa de'i mjug thogs su yang dag pa nyid du skyon med par 'jug cing /
translated: Immediately after the realization of mental attention, one enters into the faultless state of reality.

original: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs la /
analyzed: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs la /
translated: One realizes the truths.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes mthong ba la reg pa dang bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes mthong ba la reg pa dang bzhi ste /
translated: One touches the noble wisdom of seeing.

original: gzhi de la brten pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhi de la brten pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
