translated: The phrase “immediately after the basis” is the same as before.

original: dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo ste /
translated: The door of entry into the object.

original: dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo de la dmigs na yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo de la dmigs na yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “if one observes the door of entry into the object” is the same as before.

original: tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa ste /🔽tshogs yongs su bzung ba de la brten nas /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa ste / tshogs yongs su bzung ba de la brten nas /
translated: The possession of the collection.

original: yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “one enters into the faultless state of reality” is the same as before.

original: thabs yongs su bzung ba ste /🔽thabs yongs su bzung ba de la brten nas /
analyzed: thabs yongs su bzung ba ste / thabs yongs su bzung ba de la brten nas /
translated: The possession of the means.

original: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la 'jug cing zhes bya ba yang rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la 'jug cing zhes bya ba yang rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “one enters into the faultless state of reality” is the same as before.

original: rgyu lnga po 'di dag ni bden ba mngon par rtogs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyu las brtsams par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po 'di dag ni bden ba mngon par rtogs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyu las brtsams par rig par bya'i /
translated: These five causes should be understood as beginning with causes that are not conducive to the realization of the truths.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu las brtsams pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu las brtsams pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not begin with causes that are conducive to that realization.

original: rgyu de'i gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du sngar bstan pa'i phyir rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mthun par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du sngar bstan pa'i phyir rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mthun par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen as causes that are not conducive to that realization, because they are the principal causes of the realization of the truths, as they were previously taught.

original: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa'i rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa'i rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: He attends to the mental activity that is applied to emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: cha phra mo kun du sbyor ba /
analyzed: cha phra mo kun du sbyor ba /
translated: He attends to the mental activity that is applied to the subtle aspects.

original: bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par 'byung ba nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i sems kyi mtshan ma mngon par rtogs pa'i bar chad byed pa yang dag par rtogs par yid la byed do //
analyzed: bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par 'byung ba nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i sems kyi mtshan ma mngon par rtogs pa'i bar chad byed pa yang dag par rtogs par yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to the mental activity that is applied to the realization of the sign of the mind that is accompanied by the pride of thinking “I am,” which obstructs the realization of the truths, and which arises with or without obstacles.

original: rtogs nas kyang yid la byed pa de dang ldan pa'i sems rang gi ngang @274b gis 'jug pa legs par spangs nas /
analyzed: rtogs nas kyang yid la byed pa de dang ldan pa'i sems rang gi ngang @274b gis 'jug pa legs par spangs nas /
translated: Having understood this, he abandons the mental attention that is associated with that, and the mind enters its natural state.

original: sems 'gags ma thag go cog la gsar du skyes so cog gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yid la byed de //
analyzed: sems 'gags ma thag go cog la gsar du skyes so cog gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yid la byed de //
translated: He attends to the mind as it ceases and is born anew, and he attends to it as impermanent, etc., in accordance with reality.

original: yid la byed pa de la kun du bsten pa'i rgyu dang / bsgoms pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa med pa mtshungs ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa de la kun du bsten pa'i rgyu dang / bsgoms pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa med pa mtshungs ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: By the cause of repeated practice, the cause of meditation, and the cause of reliance on that mental attention, a knowledge arises that is similar to the nondiscerned object and the nondiscerned subject.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i bgegs byed pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa de spangs pas sems rtse gcig pa la reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i bgegs byed pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa de spangs pas sems rtse gcig pa la reg par 'gyur te /
translated: He abandons the pride of thinking “I am,” which is an obstacle to realization, and the distraction of the mind. Thus, he touches one-pointedness of mind.

original: bdag ni sems rtse gcig pa la reg go snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing yid la byed de /
analyzed: bdag ni sems rtse gcig pa la reg go snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing yid la byed de /
translated: He thinks, “I have touched one-pointedness of mind,” and he attends to it and understands it as it is in reality.

original: de ltar na 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i yid la byed pa rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i yid la byed pa rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this is the realization of the attention that realizes the truths.

original: gal te sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ting nge 'dzin yang thob par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ting nge 'dzin yang thob par gyur la /
translated: If one has previously attained concentration through the mundane path,

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang yang thob par gyur na ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang yang thob par gyur na ni /
translated: and if one has perfected concentration and attained mastery over concentration,

original: de'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i mtshan ma gang gis snyoms par zhugs nas gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i mtshan ma gang gis ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma de dag yid la byed cing de'i sems gnas la /
analyzed: de'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i mtshan ma gang gis snyoms par zhugs nas gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i mtshan ma gang gis ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma de dag yid la byed cing de'i sems gnas la /
translated: then one should attend to the signs of concentration by which one enters meditative equipoise, the signs of abiding in concentration by which one abides after entering meditative equipoise, and the signs of rising from concentration by which one rises from concentration.

original: bden pa rnams kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One's mind should abide in those signs and one should realize the truths.

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin thob la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin thob la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: If one has attained concentration but has not perfected concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob pa yang ma yin na ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob pa yang ma yin na ni /
translated: If one has not attained mastery of concentration,

original: de zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'am /🔽rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: de zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'am / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: one should attend to the signs of serenity,🔽the signs of exertion,

original: btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed cing /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed cing /
translated: or the signs of equanimity.

original: sems legs par gnas la /
analyzed: sems legs par gnas la /
translated: The mind will then be well-established,

original: bden pa rnams kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: and one will realize the truths.

original: de ltar na gzhi'i sgo nas sems gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhi'i sgo nas sems gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should know that the mind is well-established in terms of its basis.

original: chos 'di gnyis ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la brtson pa la shin tu bar chad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di gnyis ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la brtson pa la shin tu bar chad byed pa yin te /
translated: These two things are great obstacles for one who is striving to realize the truths:

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?🔽A disturbed mind due to bad thoughts, and an unsettled mind, and

original: rtog pa ngan pas sems dkrugs shing sems ma zhi ba dang / shes bya'i dngos po la phyin ci log pa'o //🔽bar chad byed @275a * //
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pas sems dkrugs shing sems ma zhi ba dang / shes bya'i dngos po la phyin ci log pa'o // bar chad byed @275a * //
translated: mistaken knowledge of things that are to be known.

original: pa de'i gnyen por sems kyi dmigs pa la legs par 'jug pa yang rnam pa gnyis kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pa de'i gnyen por sems kyi dmigs pa la legs par 'jug pa yang rnam pa gnyis kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: The antidotes to those obstacles are also to be known as twofold:

original: dang po'i gnyen po ni dbugs 'byung ba dang dbugs rdub pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i gnyen po ni dbugs 'byung ba dang dbugs rdub pa dran pa'o //
translated: The first is remedied by mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: cig shos kyi gnyen po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyi gnyen po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: The second is remedied by cultivating the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa la bkur sti gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa la bkur sti gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the object of meditation is to be respected.

original: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la de ltar brtson pa la ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la de ltar brtson pa la ni /
translated: For one who strives in this way in the noble Dharma and Vinaya,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyod yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyod yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: the five sense pleasures will not become the domain.

original: gal te chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes shing /
analyzed: gal te chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes shing /
translated: If one is content with just the bare minimum of Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, and seats,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti byung ngo cog zil gyis gnon cing 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti byung ngo cog zil gyis gnon cing 'di lta ste /
translated: and if one conquers whatever gain and honor arises,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten nas rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byung bas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten nas rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byung bas /
translated: then, even if gain and honor arise based on the five sense pleasures,

original: de'i sems kun nas zin cing 'dug par mi 'gyur te /🔽de tsam gyis na spyod yul ma yin pa yongs su spangs pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i sems kun nas zin cing 'dug par mi 'gyur te / de tsam gyis na spyod yul ma yin pa yongs su spangs pa yin no /
translated: one's mind will not be completely taken hold of by them.🔽To that extent, the unsuitable domain is abandoned.

original: de ltar spyod yul ma yin pa spangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyod yul ma yin pa spangs nas /
translated: Having thus abandoned the unsuitable domain,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with those very applications of mindfulness,

original: nyin mtshan su spong ba la dga' ba dang / bsgom pa la dga' bar byed pa dang / sems kun du skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir dus dus su bdag nyid la sogs pa'i rgud pa dang / 'byor pa yid la byed pa dang / sems mngon par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyin mtshan su spong ba la dga' ba dang / bsgom pa la dga' bar byed pa dang / sems kun du skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir dus dus su bdag nyid la sogs pa'i rgud pa dang / 'byor pa yid la byed pa dang / sems mngon par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sogs par byed pa ste /
translated: he delights in abandoning them day and night, delights in cultivating them, and from time to time brings to mind his own and others' misfortunes and good fortune in order to generate mental weariness. He also practices recollection of the Buddha and so on in order to gladden the mind.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Thus he abides in the arya's lineage.

original: 'di ni sems gnas pa'i gtso bo'i tshogs kyi lam gyi skabs las tshogs pa yin par rig par bya'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sems gnas pa'i gtso bo'i tshogs kyi lam gyi skabs las tshogs pa yin par rig par bya'o / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa drug pa /
translated: This is the collection of the principal mental states on the path of accumulation.

original: de ltar de tshogs la gnas pa na /
analyzed: de ltar de tshogs la gnas pa na /
translated: Thus, when he abides in that collection,

original: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa la spyod pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa la spyod pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two methods of practice for the bodhisattva who engages in mental attention to yoga.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: bdag nyid mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi lung mnod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi lung mnod pa la brten nas /
translated: Relying on the Dharma of the scriptures, the Sutras, etc.,

original: yang dag par yid la byed pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: yang dag par yid la byed pa'i rgyus /
translated: he generates the correct mental attentions.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa dang / pha rol bla ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa dang / pha rol bla ma 'di lta ste /
translated: He becomes skilled in the things of the aggregates, etc.,🔽and from time to time he receives the instructions and teachings from the guru,

original: ston pa'am / slob dpon nam /🔽mkhan po'i man ngag la brten nas /
analyzed: ston pa'am / slob dpon nam / mkhan po'i man ngag la brten nas /
translated: the teacher, the preceptor, or the master,

original: dus dus su gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa yongs su blang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dus dus su gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa yongs su blang ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to receive the instructions and teachings.

original: bla ma la brten pa'o//
analyzed: bla ma la brten pa'o//
translated: This is the mental attention of correct application.

original: @275b yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa yang thabs gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @275b yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa yang thabs gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mental attention of correct application is the third method.

original: de la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the mental attention of correct application is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni don gyi skabs 'dir tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni don gyi skabs 'dir tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bya ste /
translated: Correct application is pure morality in this context.

original: de yid la byed pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yid la byed pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The mental attention to that is the mental attention of correct application.

original: de bdag gi tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yid la byed pa na 'gyod pa med do //
analyzed: de bdag gi tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yid la byed pa na 'gyod pa med do //
translated: When they attend to the purity of their morality, they have no regrets.

original: 'gyod pa med pas mchog tu dga' bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pas mchog tu dga' bar 'gyur ba nas /
translated: Because they have no regrets, they experience supreme joy.

original: rgyas par sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyas par sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: This is elaborated up to the point of mental concentration.

original: de bas na yang dag par sbyor ba yid la byed pa yang sems gnas par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par sbyor ba yid la byed pa yang sems gnas par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the attention of correct application is also called the method for stabilizing the mind.

original: thabs de lta bus myur du sems gnas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe de rgyu rnam pa lnga po /
analyzed: thabs de lta bus myur du sems gnas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // gang gi tshe de rgyu rnam pa lnga po /
translated: It should be understood that by such a method, the mind is quickly stabilized.🔽When they have eliminated craving for those five causes,

original: rnam pa nyi shus bsdus pa de dag gi sred pa zad pa /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus bsdus pa de dag gi sred pa zad pa /
translated: which are included in the twenty aspects,

original: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la sems legs par gnas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la sems legs par gnas par gyur pa na /
translated: and their minds are well-stabilized in cessation, in nirvana,

original: yongs su yi chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su yi chad pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are completely disgusted,

original: de'i yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: their minds do not turn back.

original: bdag gi bdag gang yang med do zhes /
analyzed: bdag gi bdag gang yang med do zhes /
translated: They think, “There is no self at all in the self.”

original: sems gnas par gyur pa'i mod la bden pa rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems gnas par gyur pa'i mod la bden pa rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The moment their minds are stabilized, it is called the realization of the truth.

original: 'di ni bden pa rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the realization of the truth.

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i don 'di'i rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i don 'di'i rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation of the meaning of the realization of the truth is as follows:

original: sems skyo bar bya ba'i rnam pa nyi shu dang / sems gnas pa'i rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: sems skyo bar bya ba'i rnam pa nyi shu dang / sems gnas pa'i rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: It should be understood that these twenty aspects of the mind that are to be calmed and these twenty aspects of the mind that are to be stabilized are the ones that are referred to.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There are none of higher status and there are none that are more excellent than these.

original: de la bar du gcod pa yongs su spong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bar du gcod pa yongs su spong ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete avoidance of the hindrances?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: bar du gcod pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that there are two kinds of hindrances:

original: rgyu ba dang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang gnas pa'o //
translated: those that pertain to activity and those that pertain to abiding.

original: de la rgyu ba'i bar du gcod pa ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu ba'i bar du gcod pa ni /
translated: Among them, the hindrances that pertain to activity are as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos kyi tshogs kyi nang na gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos kyi tshogs kyi nang na gnas shing /
translated: For example, a noble disciple is dwelling among the assembly of monks.

original: dge 'dun gyi bya ba byung ngo cog la dge ba'i phyogs 'dor zhing rgyun du tshogs kyi nang du 'du ba dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid du gnas shing kha zas la gces par 'dzin pa dang / gnyi gar yang chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa 'phral gyi bya ba'i las la brtson gzhing de la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bya ba byung ngo cog la dge ba'i phyogs 'dor zhing rgyun du tshogs kyi nang du 'du ba dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid du gnas shing kha zas la gces par 'dzin pa dang / gnyi gar yang chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa 'phral gyi bya ba'i las la brtson gzhing de la dga' ba dang /
translated: those who remain as alms-collectors and cherish food, and those who in both cases delight in the immediate activities of the saṅgha, such as the Dharma robes and the alms bowl.

original: kha ton la brtson pa'i smra ba la dga' ba dang / mtshan mo gnas pa na gnyid la dga' ba dang / nyin par gnas pa na rgyal po dang @276a * //
analyzed: kha ton la brtson pa'i smra ba la dga' ba dang / mtshan mo gnas pa na gnyid la dga' ba dang / nyin par gnas pa na rgyal po dang @276a * //
translated: They are those who delight in recitation and in talk, those who delight in sleep when staying at night, and those who delight in the afflictive stories of kings and thieves

original: chom rkun la sogs pa'i gtam kun nas nyon mongs pa can la dga' ba dang / yul gang na nye du dang / phebs par smra ba dang / grogs bshes dang / smon 'grin dang / byams pa rnams gnas pa'i yul de dang mi 'bral bar dga' zhing /
analyzed: chom rkun la sogs pa'i gtam kun nas nyon mongs pa can la dga' ba dang / yul gang na nye du dang / phebs par smra ba dang / grogs bshes dang / smon 'grin dang / byams pa rnams gnas pa'i yul de dang mi 'bral bar dga' zhing /
translated: when staying during the day. They are those who delight in not being separated from the place where their relatives, friends, companions, acquaintances, and loved ones live.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: de dag dang 'grogs pa 'ga' zhig gi dbang du byas nas yun ring po nas goms pa'i shugs kyis zla dang bcas par gnas par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de dag dang 'grogs pa 'ga' zhig gi dbang du byas nas yun ring po nas goms pa'i shugs kyis zla dang bcas par gnas par dga' ba ste /
translated: Some people, because of their long-standing habit of associating with those who are not good friends, delight in staying with their companions.

original: 'di ni rgyu'i bar du gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'i bar du gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called an obstacle to the cause.

original: gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an obstacle to abiding?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: dben pa na 'dug cing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brtsams nas /
analyzed: dben pa na 'dug cing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la ni gnas pa zhes bya'o // de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brtsams nas /
translated: it is called abiding when one is in solitude and cultivates tranquility and insight.

original: bar du gcod pa rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, there are four kinds of obstacles to tranquility and insight.

original: lhag mthong gi yan lag dang mi mthun pa dang / zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang mi mthun pa dang / de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi dran pa dang mi mthun pa dang / gnas dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi yan lag dang mi mthun pa dang / zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang mi mthun pa dang / de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi dran pa dang mi mthun pa dang / gnas dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: They are: the obstacle to the limbs of tranquility, the obstacle to the limbs of insight, the obstacle to the side of both of them, and the obstacle to mindfulness.🔽The obstacle to the limbs of tranquility is fourfold: laziness, lack of desire to strive, lack of confidence, and over-exertion or lack of exertion.

original: bdag nyid mkhas par 'dzin pas gzhan la lhag mthong dang mthun pa'i dam pa'i chos mi nyan pa ni lhag mthong gi yan lag mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid mkhas par 'dzin pas gzhan la lhag mthong dang mthun pa'i dam pa'i chos mi nyan pa ni lhag mthong gi yan lag mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The lack of concordance with insight is the failure to listen to the true Dharma from others because of the pride of thinking oneself learned.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa mi brtan zhing g-yo bas /🔽yang dang yang du tshul khrims nyams par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa mi brtan zhing g-yo bas / yang dang yang du tshul khrims nyams par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The lack of concordance with serenity is the instability and agitation of the body, speech, and mind.🔽Because of that, one is frequently remorseful and so forth, and one does not attain the stability of mind.

original: 'gyod pa la sogs pas sems gnas pa'i bar du thob par mi 'gyur ba ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang mi mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa la sogs pas sems gnas pa'i bar du thob par mi 'gyur ba ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang mi mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these are the lack of concordance with serenity.

original: brjed ngas pa'i dbang du byas nas rgod pa dang / bying ba la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems kun du mi byung ba ni de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi dran pa dang mi mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa'i dbang du byas nas rgod pa dang / bying ba la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems kun du mi byung ba ni de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi dran pa dang mi mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the lack of concordance with both is the failure of the mind to become concentrated due to the secondary mental afflictions of agitation, depression, etc., which are due to forgetfulness.

original: nyes pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i gnas mal la brten pa ni gnas dang mi mthun pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i gnas mal la brten pa ni gnas dang mi mthun pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the lack of concordance with the place is the use of a place of dwelling that has five faults.

original: nyin par ljan ljin mang ba dang / mtshan mo sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gtse ba dang / 'jigs pa mang zhing gnod pa mang ba dang / yo byad med cing nyams mi dga' ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin cing dge ba'i bshes gnyen med pa ste /
analyzed: nyin par ljan ljin mang ba dang / mtshan mo sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gtse ba dang / 'jigs pa mang zhing gnod pa mang ba dang / yo byad med cing nyams mi dga' ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin cing dge ba'i bshes gnyen med pa ste /
translated: In the day time, there is much filth; at night, one is tormented by the suffering of mosquitoes, gadflies, etc.; there is much fear and much harm; there is no equipment, and one is not happy; one is seized by sinful friends, and there are no spiritual benefactors.

original: 'di ni gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa zhes bya'o //🔽bar du gcod pa rnam pa 'di gnyis kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa zhes bya'o // bar du gcod pa rnam pa 'di gnyis kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: This is called the obstruction to dwelling.

original: rgyu rnam ba gnyis @276b kyis yongs su spong bar rig par bya ste /🔽ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba mang du byed pa dang / so sor brtags pa mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam ba gnyis @276b kyis yongs su spong bar rig par bya ste / ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba mang du byed pa dang / so sor brtags pa mang du byed pa'o //
translated: These two kinds of obstructions are to be abandoned by means of two causes.🔽One should know that they are to be abandoned by means of the cause of delight in samadhi and the cause of thorough analysis.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba mang du byed pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba mang du byed pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Delight in samadhi is to be known as sixfold.

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin yongs su thob la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob pa yang ma yin na ni de zhi gnas la mkhas pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa la mkhas pa dang / btang snyoms la mkhas par byed cing ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba shas cher skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs la /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin yongs su thob la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob pa yang ma yin na ni de zhi gnas la mkhas pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa la mkhas pa dang / btang snyoms la mkhas par byed cing ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba shas cher skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs la /
translated: If one has attained concentration but not perfected it, and has not attained mastery over concentration, then one will be skilled in tranquility, skilled in exertion, and skilled in equanimity, and one will greatly delight in concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob na ni ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba la mkhas par byed cing ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba shas cher skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob na ni ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba la mkhas par byed cing ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba shas cher skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has perfected concentration and attained mastery over concentration, then one will be skilled in concentration, skilled in abiding in concentration, and skilled in emerging from concentration, and one will greatly delight in concentration.

original: de la so sor brtags pa mang du byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa mang du byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of investigation?

original: shes rab dge ba la ni so sor brtags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab dge ba la ni so sor brtags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Wisdom is called investigation.

original: de shes rab des nyin mtshan du bdag gi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: de shes rab des nyin mtshan du bdag gi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: With that wisdom, they know exactly how their virtuous qualities increase day and night.🔽They know exactly how their nonvirtuous qualities increase.

original: mi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'bri ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'bri ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: They know exactly how their virtuous qualities decrease.🔽They know exactly how their nonvirtuous qualities decrease.

original: mi dge ba'i chos 'bri ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / nyin mtshan du rgyu ba dang gnas pa na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos 'bri ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / nyin mtshan du rgyu ba dang gnas pa na /
translated: When they go out or stay still,

original: chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'tsho ba bsgrub pa rnams la sa sor brten pa na /🔽mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur la /🔽dge ba'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'tsho ba bsgrub pa rnams la sa sor brten pa na / mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur la / dge ba'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: when they obtain robes, alms, and so forth,🔽they know exactly how nonvirtuous qualities increase🔽and virtuous qualities decrease.

original: yang na dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: Or they know exactly how virtuous qualities increase🔽and nonvirtuous qualities decrease.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / so sor brtags pa de nyid la brten na mi dge ba'i chos de dag skyes so cog ni dang du mi len pa'i tshul gyis sel zhing nyams smod cing nges par spong bar byed la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / so sor brtags pa de nyid la brten na mi dge ba'i chos de dag skyes so cog ni dang du mi len pa'i tshul gyis sel zhing nyams smod cing nges par spong bar byed la /
translated: And, based on that very investigation, he eliminates, abandons, and gets rid of whatever nonvirtuous phenomena have arisen, by not tolerating them.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams ni sgom par byed pa ste /🔽gnas gnyis su gtogs pa'i mkhas pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gis gnas gnyis su gtogs pa'i bar du gcod pa @277a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams ni sgom par byed pa ste / gnas gnyis su gtogs pa'i mkhas pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gis gnas gnyis su gtogs pa'i bar du gcod pa @277a * //
translated: He cultivates virtuous phenomena.

original: rnam pa bcu gcig po spong zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig po spong zhing /
translated: The wise person who is endowed with these ten qualities that pertain to the two states abandons the eleven types of obstacles that pertain to the two states.🔽And he abandons whatever obstacles arise.

original: byung ngo cog yongs su spong bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni bar du gcod pa yongs su spong bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: byung ngo cog yongs su spong bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni bar du gcod pa yongs su spong bzhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the abandonment of obstacles.”

original: bar du gcod pa yongs su spang ba'i don 'di'i rgyas par ni 'di yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa yongs su spang ba'i don 'di'i rgyas par ni 'di yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The following is an extensive explanation of the meaning of “the abandonment of obstacles.”

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa dag tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa dag tu rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand it in the aspects taught here.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: mngon par rtogs par gyur pa'i mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par gyur pa'i mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mental attention to the object of supreme joy in order to quickly attain the superknowledges of one who has realized?

original: de ltar 'phags pa nyan thos bden pa mthong ba des shes nas dad pa thob par gyur cing de shes nas dad pa de nyid la brten nas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yon tan gyi zhing yin par yid la byed pa'i sgo nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa nyan thos bden pa mthong ba des shes nas dad pa thob par gyur cing de shes nas dad pa de nyid la brten nas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yon tan gyi zhing yin par yid la byed pa'i sgo nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa dang /
translated: Thus, the noble disciple who has seen the truth, having understood and attained faith, and having relied on that faith, generates supreme joy by considering the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha as fields of good qualities.

original: bdag nyid mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa la brten nas /
translated: And he generates supreme joy by considering himself as having attained the high and the auspicious.

original: lus dang / longs spyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yid la byed pas kyang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa dang / phrag dog med pa la brten nas /
analyzed: lus dang / longs spyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yid la byed pas kyang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa dang / phrag dog med pa la brten nas /
translated: One should also generate supreme joy by keeping in mind the perfection of body, possessions, and understanding, and by being free of envy.

original: bdag la ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan dag gi 'byor pa la yang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa dang / byas pa gzo ba la brten nas 'di lta ste /🔽sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa bsal ba dang / bde ba rgyu dang bcas par bsgrub pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag la ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan dag gi 'byor pa la yang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa dang / byas pa gzo ba la brten nas 'di lta ste / sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa bsal ba dang / bde ba rgyu dang bcas par bsgrub pa las brtsams te /
translated: One should also generate supreme joy by being free of envy, as if one were happy at the good fortune of others just as one is happy at one's own good fortune.

original: ston pa phan 'dogs pa'i phan btags pa rjes su dran zhing yid la byed pas kyang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa phan 'dogs pa'i phan btags pa rjes su dran zhing yid la byed pas kyang mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: One should also generate supreme joy by being grateful, remembering and keeping in mind the teacher's kindness in beginning to remove suffering and its causes and to establish happiness and its causes.

original: de ltar 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam dang mthun pas mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'i dngos po yid la byed pa mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam dang mthun pas mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'i dngos po yid la byed pa mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one should keep in mind the things that generate supreme joy, which are in harmony with the path of meditation, and one will quickly attain the superknowledges.

original: bsgom pa'i lam dang mthun pa mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed par don 'di'i rgyas par ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam dang mthun pa mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed par don 'di'i rgyas par ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should bring to mind the supreme joy that is conducive to the path of cultivation.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: ji ltar thob pa'i lam bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa'i lam bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the path as it has been attained?

original: de de ltar mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po kha na ma tho ba med pas sems brlan pa mthar thug par 'gro ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de de ltar mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po kha na ma tho ba med pas sems brlan pa mthar thug par 'gro ba las brtsams nas /
translated: Thus, beginning with the ultimate stage of the mind being moistened by the vast, irreproachable supreme joy,

original: tshe 'di la sems kyis shin tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la sems kyis shin tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: one becomes extremely joyful in this life.

original: de ltar dga' ba dang ldan pa de bdag nam zhig 'phags pa dgra bcom pas bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de ltar dga' ba dang ldan pa de bdag nam zhig 'phags pa dgra bcom pas bsgrubs te /
