analyzed: de ltar na sngar bstan pa'i 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the purification of all aspects that was taught previously, and the purification of all aspects that is supramundane, when these two are combined into one, that is called the result of meditation.

original: de ltar na ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i gzhi gang yin pa de dang / ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang / ji skad bstan pa'i rnal 'byor du bsgom pa nyid gang yin pa de dang / ji skad bstan pa'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i gzhi gang yin pa de dang / ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang / ji skad bstan pa'i rnal 'byor du bsgom pa nyid gang yin pa de dang / ji skad bstan pa'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the basis of meditation as it was taught, the cause of meditation as it was taught, the very practice of meditation as it was taught, and the result of meditation as it was taught, that is called the stage that arises from meditation.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa rdzogs so /
translated: In the Bodhisattvabhumi, the stage that arises from meditation is complete.

original: // / de'i 'og ma nyan thos kyi sa ni glegs bam logs shig na yod do //
analyzed: // / de'i 'og ma nyan thos kyi sa ni glegs bam logs shig na yod do //
translated: The stage of the śrāvakas that comes after it is in a separate book.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage of the Solitary Sage?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as being fivefold:

original: rigs dang / lam dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / gnas pa dang / rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rigs dang / lam dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / gnas pa dang / rgyu ba'o //
translated: family, path, achievement, abode, and activity.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the family of the Solitary Sage?

original: de ni mtshan nyid gsum du rig par bya ste /🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par byang chub pa'i snga rol nyid nas /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid gsum du rig par bya ste / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par byang chub pa'i snga rol nyid nas /
translated: It should be understood as being threefold:

original: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rigs yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rigs yin te /
translated: From the very beginning, the Solitary Sages are by nature of little defilement.

original: des na de dag gi sems 'du 'dzi la mi 'jug gi / gcig pu dga' ba la 'jug go //🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i snga rol nyid nas /
analyzed: des na de dag gi sems 'du 'dzi la mi 'jug gi / gcig pu dga' ba la 'jug go // rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i snga rol nyid nas /
translated: Therefore, their minds are not inclined to society, but to solitude.

original: rang bzhin gyis snying rje chung ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis snying rje chung ba yin te /
translated: From the very beginning, the Solitary Sages are by nature of little compassion.

original: des na de dag gi sems @279b chos ston pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la sems mi 'jug gi / sems las chung ngur gnas pa la sems 'jug go //
analyzed: des na de dag gi sems @279b chos ston pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la sems mi 'jug gi / sems las chung ngur gnas pa la sems 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, their minds are not inclined to the teaching of the Dharma or to the service of living beings, but to solitude.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i snga rol nyid nas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i snga rol nyid nas /
translated: Solitary realizers, prior to manifest, complete buddhahood,🔽

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring dang / nga rgyal spyad pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring dang / nga rgyal spyad pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: Solitary realizers are naturally of middling faculties and naturally have the character of being proud.

original: des na slob dpon med pa dang / 'gran zla med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod do //
analyzed: des na slob dpon med pa dang / 'gran zla med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, they aspire to manifest complete buddhahood without a teacher and without a rival.

original: de ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang mtshan nyid gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang mtshan nyid gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus the path of the solitary realizers should be understood as having three characteristics.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs la gnas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs la gnas la /
translated: In this regard, some abide in the potential of a solitary realizer

original: bskal pa brgyar sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed de /🔽der yang 'di lta ste /🔽rang byang chub tu rgyud yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed de / der yang 'di lta ste / rang byang chub tu rgyud yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: and for one hundred eons they please the buddhas.🔽In that regard, they fully ripen their mindstream for solitary realizers.

original: 'di ltar phyis rang byang chub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyis rang byang chub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And in this way, later they attain solitary realizers’ enlightenment.

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas par byed de /
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas par byed de /
translated: They are expertise in the aggregates, expertise in the sources, expertise in the constituents, expertise in dependent origination, expertise in what is correct and incorrect, and expertise in the truths.

original: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang po'o //
translated: This is the first bodhisattva path.

original: gzhan yang 'di na la la sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyas par byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na la la sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyas par byas nas /
translated: Moreover, here someone, having met a buddha,

original: skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas nges par 'byed ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon ma bskyed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas nges par 'byed ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon ma bskyed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: having relied on a holy person, having listened to the holy Dharma, and having properly contemplated it, generates roots of virtue that are conducive to definite separation, which were not previously generated, such as heat, the peak, and patience.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa rnams bskyed cing mngon par bsgrub la tshe de nyid la chos mngon par rtogs par byas pa'am /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa rnams bskyed cing mngon par bsgrub la tshe de nyid la chos mngon par rtogs par byas pa'am /
translated: Having generated and accomplished them, they realize the Dharma in that very lifetime.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par byed ni mi nus te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par byed ni mi nus te /
translated: They cannot attain the result of being a sramanera.

original: 'di ltar phyis mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir phung po la mkhas pa dang skye mched la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyis mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir phung po la mkhas pa dang skye mched la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang /
translated: Because later they must realize the four noble truths and attain the result of being a sramanera, they must become skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the sense spheres, skilled in the elements, skilled in dependent origination,

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: skilled in what is possible and impossible, and skilled in the four noble truths.

original: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second path of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan yang 'di na la la sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byas nas skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la brten @280a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na la la sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byas nas skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la brten @280a * //
translated: Moreover, here someone, having pleased a buddha, relies on a holy person, listens to the sublime Dharma, and attends to it properly.

original: nas chos mngon par rtogs par byed cing dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur la thams cad kyi thams cad du shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang shin tu tshangs par spyod pa'i mthar gyur pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid thob par ni mi nus te /
analyzed: nas chos mngon par rtogs par byed cing dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur la thams cad kyi thams cad du shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang shin tu tshangs par spyod pa'i mthar gyur pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid thob par ni mi nus te /
translated: They realize the teachings, attain the fruits of spiritual practice, but they are unable to attain the fruit of arhatship, which is the ultimate perfection, the ultimate purity, and the ultimate practice of celibacy.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because🔽they attain the fruit of arhatship, which is the ultimate perfection, the ultimate purity, and the ultimate practice of celibacy, by means of the supramundane path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis phyis shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang shin tu tshangs par spyod pa'i mthar gyur pa'i dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir phung po la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis phyis shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang shin tu tshangs par spyod pa'i mthar gyur pa'i dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir phung po la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang /
translated: They are skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the bases,

original: khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: skilled in the elements, skilled in dependent origination, skilled in what is possible and impossible, and skilled in the truths.

original: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third path of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang pos bskal pa brgya tshang bar tshogs bsags nas bskal pa brgya 'das pa'i 'og tu sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa na slob dpon med par byang chub kyi
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang pos bskal pa brgya tshang bar tshogs bsags nas bskal pa brgya 'das pa'i 'og tu sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa na slob dpon med par byang chub kyi
translated: In this regard, correct establishment is as follows: Here someone, having gathered the accumulations for a full one hundred eons by means of the first path of a pratyekabuddha, after one hundred eons have passed, when buddhas do not appear, they attain enlightenment without a master.🔽

original: phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms nas rang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms nas rang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed do //
translated: Correct attainment is as follows: Here someone gathers the accumulations for one hundred eons by means of the first path of a pratyekabuddha and after one hundred eons have passed, when buddhas do not appear, he meditates on the thirty seven factors of enlightenment without a teacher and manifests the state of an arhat who has abandoned all afflictions and is a self realized buddha.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gnyis ba dang / gsum pas rgyu de dang rkyen des sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa kho na'i tshe slob dpon med par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms nas chos mngon par rtogs par byed cing dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du yang thob par 'gyur
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gnyis ba dang / gsum pas rgyu de dang rkyen des sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa kho na'i tshe slob dpon med par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms nas chos mngon par rtogs par byed cing dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du yang thob par 'gyur
translated: Thus, some here, by the second and third paths of the pratyekabuddha, without a master, cultivate the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and realize the Dharma, and they also attain the fruit of an arhat.

original: ro // yang na ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob nas shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang shin tu tshangs par spyod pa'i mthar gyur pa'i 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // yang na ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob nas shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang shin tu tshangs par spyod pa'i mthar gyur pa'i 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, having attained the fruit of a śramaṇa, they attain the supreme fruit of arhatship, which is the culmination of the extremely perfected, the extremely stainless, and the extremely pure celibate life.

original: de la yang dge bar 'grub pa dang pos ni bse ru ltar spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang dge bar 'grub pa dang pos ni bse ru ltar spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, by the first establishment of virtue, they become pratyekabuddhas who practice like a rhinoceros.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa gnyis pa dang gsum pas ni tshogs dang spyod pa'i rang rgyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa gnyis pa dang gsum pas ni tshogs dang spyod pa'i rang rgyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The second and third correct endeavors are the pratyekabuddha vehicle, because they are the collection and the practice.

original: bse ru lta bu spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But they do not become the rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la yang gnas pa ni bse ru ltar sbyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas gang yin pa de ni gcig pu 'dug pa dga' @280b zhing gcig pu gnas la zab mo la mos pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo la so sor rtog pa lhur len pa dang /
analyzed: de la yang gnas pa ni bse ru ltar sbyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas gang yin pa de ni gcig pu 'dug pa dga' @280b zhing gcig pu gnas la zab mo la mos pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo la so sor rtog pa lhur len pa dang /
translated: The rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas are those who delight in solitude, live alone, are devoted to profound discernment of the profound dependent origination,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yid la byed cing gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yid la byed cing gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and abide in the mental attentions of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de la yang dag par 'grub pa gnyis pa dang gsum pas ni gcig tu nges par gcig pu 'dug pa la dga' zhing gcig pu gnas pa'i rang rgyal bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi tshogs dang gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'grub pa gnyis pa dang gsum pas ni gcig tu nges par gcig pu 'dug pa la dga' zhing gcig pu gnas pa'i rang rgyal bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi tshogs dang gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The second and third correct endeavors are not the pratyekabuddha vehicle, because they are the collection and the practice.

original: gnas pa lhag ma ni de yang bse ru ltar spyad pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas pa lhag ma ni de yang bse ru ltar spyad pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The rest of the abodes are the same as the rhinoceros-like.

original: de la rgyu ba ni de dag thams cad grong ngam grong rdal gang du rten cing gnas kyang ste de dag lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang dbang po rnams shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa la shin tu gnas pas grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du bsod snyoms la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu ba ni de dag thams cad grong ngam grong rdal gang du rten cing gnas kyang ste de dag lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang dbang po rnams shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa la shin tu gnas pas grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du bsod snyoms la 'jug ste /
translated: The “wandering” refers to the fact that they live in a village or town, but they are very restrained in their bodies and senses, and they are very stable in their mindfulness.

original: pha rol dma' ba dang sman pa rnams la snying brtse bar byed pas yang lus kyis snying brtse bar byed kyi ngag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol dma' ba dang sman pa rnams la snying brtse bar byed pas yang lus kyis snying brtse bar byed kyi ngag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: They enter the village or town for alms, and they are compassionate to others, but they are compassionate with their bodies, not with their speech.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni lus kyis chos ston pa yin gyi ngag gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni lus kyis chos ston pa yin gyi ngag gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because they teach the Dharma with their bodies, not with their speech.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zhe 'gras pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma ston par byed do //
translated: they display various miracles in order to turn away those who are hostile.

original: de dag thams cad ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa yin par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa yin par rig par bya'o /
translated: All of these should be understood as the one path that leads to the pacification of the mental afflictions.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rang sangs rgyas kyis rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rang sangs rgyas kyis rdzogs so /
translated: The stage of the solitary realizer is finished.

original: // / de'i 'og ma byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni glegs bam logs shig na yod do //
analyzed: // / de'i 'og ma byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni glegs bam logs shig na yod do //
translated: The stage of the bodhisattva is found in a separate text.

original: phung po dang bcas pa'i sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phung po dang bcas pa'i sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage that possesses the heaps?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of three types:

original: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / nye bar zhi bar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / phung por gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / nye bar zhi bar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / phung por gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the stage that is designated as a stage, the presentation of the stage that is designated as peace, and the presentation of the stage that is designated as a heap.

original: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the stage that is designated as a stage?

original: phung po dang bcas pa'i sa ni sa lnga po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phung po dang bcas pa'i sa ni sa lnga po 'di lta ste /
translated: The stage that possesses the heaps is the five stages that are:

original: sems med pa'i sa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa dang / nyan thos kyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams las phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa dang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i sa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa dang / nyan thos kyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams las phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa dang 'di lta ste /
translated: the stage that is devoid of mind, the stage that is derived from meditation, the stage of the śrāvakas, the stage of the bodhisattvas, and one portion of the stage of the tathāgatas.

original: phung po med pa'i sa gcig ril gyis ma gtogs pa'i sa lhag ma rnams ni phung po dang bcas pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po med pa'i sa gcig ril gyis ma gtogs pa'i sa lhag ma rnams ni phung po dang bcas pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The remaining stages, with the exception of the stage of no-aggregates, are called stages with aggregates.

original: 'di ni sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the presentation of the stages.

original: nye bar zhi bar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the stages of peace?

original: @281a * // phung po dang bcas pa'i sa ni nye bar zhib rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: @281a * // phung po dang bcas pa'i sa ni nye bar zhib rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The stages with aggregates are presented as four kinds of peace:

original: sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang / nyon mongs la nye bar zhi ba dang / sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba nye bar zhi ba dang / btang snyoms nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang / nyon mongs la nye bar zhi ba dang / sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba nye bar zhi ba dang / btang snyoms nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: peace of suffering, peace of afflictions, peace of harm to sentient beings, and peace of equanimity.

original: de la dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i phyi ma la srid pa 'byung bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal la gang yin pa de ta la'i mgo bcad pa bzhin du yongs su shes nas spangs shing rtsa nas bcad de phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos
analyzed: de la dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i phyi ma la srid pa 'byung bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal la gang yin pa de ta la'i mgo bcad pa bzhin du yongs su shes nas spangs shing rtsa nas bcad de phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos
translated: Among them, a bhikṣu who is an arhat whose contaminants have ceased, having fully understood the suffering that arises in future lives like the head of a tāla tree, abandons it, cuts it off at the root, makes it like a lamp that is extinguished, and makes it not arise in the future.

original: nyid kyis mi snang bar gyur pa de ni de'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyid kyis mi snang bar gyur pa de ni de'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: The disappearance of the self is the pacification of its suffering.

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa'i gtan mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyis 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / zhe sdang ma lus pa dang / gti mug ma lus pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa de ni de'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa'i gtan mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyis 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / zhe sdang ma lus pa dang / gti mug ma lus pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa de ni de'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: The pacification of the afflictions of the arhat monk is the complete abandonment of desire, the complete abandonment of hatred, the complete abandonment of delusion, and the complete abandonment of all afflictions.

original: de ni 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad zad pas /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad zad pas /
translated: Because of the complete abandonment of desire, the complete abandonment of hatred, the complete abandonment of delusion, and the complete abandonment of all afflictions,

original: sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed la /
analyzed: sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed la /
translated: he does not commit any evil.

original: dge ba la rten par byed pa de ni nyon mongs la rnam par 'tshe ba nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba la rten par byed pa de ni nyon mongs la rnam par 'tshe ba nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: He relies on virtue. This is the pacification of the harm of the afflictions.

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni bde bar gnas pa rnam pa drug po 'di dag gis rtag par rgyun du shas cher gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni bde bar gnas pa rnam pa drug po 'di dag gis rtag par rgyun du shas cher gnas te /
translated: The arhat monk, whose contaminants have ceased, always and constantly relies on these six kinds of happiness.

original: de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na /
analyzed: de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na /
translated: When he sees forms with his eyes,

original: yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /🔽yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur bar dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis btang stoms su gnas pa dang / de rna bas sgra rnams thos pa dang / snas dri rnams bsnams pa dang / lces ro rnams myangs pa dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams la reg pa dang /
analyzed: yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur / yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur bar dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis btang stoms su gnas pa dang / de rna bas sgra rnams thos pa dang / snas dri rnams bsnams pa dang / lces ro rnams myangs pa dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams la reg pa dang /
translated: He does not become happy or unhappy.🔽He remains equanimous, mindful and clearly comprehending.

original: yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: When he hears sounds with his ears, smells scents with his nose, tastes flavors with his tongue, touches touchables with his body, or is conscious of mental objects with his mind, he does not become happy or unhappy.🔽He remains equanimous, mindful and clearly comprehending.

original: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur bar dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis btang snyoms su gnas pa de ni de'i btang snyoms nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur bar dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis btang snyoms su gnas pa de ni de'i btang snyoms nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: That is his equanimity, his tranquility.

original: nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi pa de dag las brtsams nas phung po dang bcas pa'i sa la mchog tu zhi ba dang mchog tu bsil bar gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi pa de dag las brtsams nas phung po dang bcas pa'i sa la mchog tu zhi ba dang mchog tu bsil bar gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In this way, the four kinds of tranquility are explained in the context of the stage with residual conditioning.

original: de ni nye bar zhi ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nye bar zhi ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the establishment of the designation of tranquility.

original: phung po gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phung po gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the aggregates?

original: phung po ni brgyad po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: phung po ni brgyad po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are eight aggregates:

original: gdags pa'i phung po @281b dang / yongs su gzung ba'i phung po dang / gnas pa'i phung po dang / 'jug pa'i phung po dang / bar du gcod pa'i phung po dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang / dga' ba'i phung po dang / tha ma'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gdags pa'i phung po @281b dang / yongs su gzung ba'i phung po dang / gnas pa'i phung po dang / 'jug pa'i phung po dang / bar du gcod pa'i phung po dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang / dga' ba'i phung po dang / tha ma'i phung po'o //
translated: the aggregate of designation, the aggregate of appropriation, the aggregate of dwelling, the aggregate of engagement, the aggregate of obstruction, the aggregate of suffering, the aggregate of pleasure, and the final aggregate.

original: gdags pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gdags pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of designation?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams te /
translated: It is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: gang la brten na bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang la brten na bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: It is on the basis of them that the designations “self,”

original: sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can nam /
translated: “sentient being,”🔽“living being,”

original: srog gam / skye ba'am /
analyzed: srog gam / skye ba'am /
translated: “creature,”🔽“person,”🔽“human being,”🔽“man,”🔽“I,”🔽“mine,”🔽“this,”🔽“that,”🔽“here,”🔽“there,”🔽“long,”🔽“short,”🔽“small,”🔽“large,”

original: gso ba'am / skyes bu'am /
analyzed: gso ba'am / skyes bu'am /
translated: “one,”🔽“two,”🔽“three,”🔽“many,”🔽“few,”🔽“some,”

original: gang zag gam /
analyzed: gang zag gam /
translated: “other,”🔽“this much,”🔽“that much,”🔽“this far,”🔽“that far,”🔽“past,”🔽“future,”🔽“present,”🔽“male,”🔽“female,”🔽“neuter,”🔽“good,”🔽“bad,”

original: shed las skyes sam /
analyzed: shed las skyes sam /
translated: “virtuous,”🔽“nonvirtuous,”🔽“indeterminate,”🔽“learner,”🔽“nonlearner,”

original: shed bu zhes bya bar ming dang brda dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad du 'dogs pa dang / gang la brten nas ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: shed bu zhes bya bar ming dang brda dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad du 'dogs pa dang / gang la brten nas ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: “neither learner nor nonlearner,”

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: “stream enterer,”🔽“once-returner,”🔽“nonreturner,”🔽“arhat,”

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: “bodhisattva,”🔽“buddha,”🔽and so on are made.

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: They eat such and such food,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /🔽tshe ni 'di ltar ring /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong / tshe ni 'di ltar ring /
translated: they experience such and such happiness and suffering,🔽they live so long,

original: yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
translated: they live for so long,

original: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya bar ming dang / brda dang / gdags pa dang tha snyad du 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya bar ming dang / brda dang / gdags pa dang tha snyad du 'dogs pa'o //
translated: they live for so long.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of appropriation?

original: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun te /🔽bdag dang / pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / zan dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / grogs po dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams nas rgyas par yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun te / bdag dang / pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / zan dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / grogs po dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams nas rgyas par yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun po 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the seven kinds of appropriation:🔽self, father, mother, son, wife, servant, worker, hired person, friend, companion, minister, relative, family member, and so on.

original: yid kyis las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: yid kyis las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: It is the seven kinds of appropriation, as they occur in the mind.

original: gang dag la brten nas sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la brten nas sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the appropriation of beings.

original: gnas pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of remaining?

original: zas bzhi ste /
analyzed: zas bzhi ste /
translated: It is the four nutriments:

original: kham dang / reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
analyzed: kham dang / reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
translated: the nutriment of edible food, the nutriment of contact, the nutriment of mental volition, and the nutriment of consciousness.

original: gang la brten na sems can byung ba rnams gnas shing 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dang / 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la brten na sems can byung ba rnams gnas shing 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dang / 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is that on which sentient beings who have come to be remain and live, and which benefits those who seek to come to be.

original: 'jug pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of engagement?

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the four stations of consciousness and the twelve members of dependent origination, namely:

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang / tshor bar gtogs pa dang / 'du shes su gtogs pa dang / 'du byed du gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang / tshor bar gtogs pa dang / 'du shes su gtogs pa dang / 'du byed du gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: the station of consciousness belonging to the form realm, the station of consciousness belonging to the formless realm, the station of consciousness not destined to retrogress, and the station of consciousness destined to retrogress.🔽The twelve members of dependent origination are:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / 'du @282a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / 'du @282a * //
translated: the formations conditioned by ignorance,

original: byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa nas rgyas par skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa nas rgyas par skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: the consciousness conditioned by the formations, and so on, up to: old age and death conditioned by birth.

original: gang la brten na sems rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang la brten na sems rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is that on which the mind depends in order to enter into the five destinies of transmigration.

original: bar du gcod pa'i phung po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i phung po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What is the group of obstacles?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: lha'i bu'i bdud de dge ba de dang de dag la brtson pa rnams la bgegs byed pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud de dge ba de dang de dag la brtson pa rnams la bgegs byed pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the Mara of the sons of gods who is present in order to create obstacles to the practice of the good.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the group of suffering?

original: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the totality of the world of desire which is called the group of suffering.

original: gang la brten na sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang la brten na sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that on which the mind depends in order to experience suffering and mental dissatisfactions.

original: dga' ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the group of joy?

original: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la ni dga' ba'i phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la ni dga' ba'i phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the happiness of the absorptions which is called the group of joy.

original: gang la brten na sems rnams 'dir yang snyoms par zhugs shing /
analyzed: gang la brten na sems rnams 'dir yang snyoms par zhugs shing /
translated: It is that on which the mind depends in order to enter into the absorptions.

original: der yang skyes nas yun ring por bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dga' ba so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: der yang skyes nas yun ring por bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dga' ba so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and, having been born there, he experiences the joy of the absorption of the meditations for a long time.

original: tha ma'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha ma'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the last aggregate?

original: dgra bcom pa'i rgyun gyi phung po rnams te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rgyun gyi phung po rnams te /
translated: It is the stream of aggregates of the Arhat.

original: gang la brten na dgra bcom pa la tha ma'i lus 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la brten na dgra bcom pa la tha ma'i lus 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is on the basis of this that the Arhat is said to be in his last body.

original: de la dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa phung po dang bcas pa'i sa la gnas pa /🔽phung po du dang ni ldan zhes bya /
analyzed: de la dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa phung po dang bcas pa'i sa la gnas pa / phung po du dang ni ldan zhes bya /
translated: The bhiksu, the Arhat, whose cankers are destroyed, who is established in the state of the destruction of the cankers,🔽is he said to be endowed with so many aggregates?

original: ngu dang ni mi ldan zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ngu dang ni mi ldan zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Is he said to be not endowed with so many aggregates?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: tha ma'i phung po gcig dang ni gcig tu nges par ldan no //
analyzed: tha ma'i phung po gcig dang ni gcig tu nges par ldan no //
translated: he is certainly endowed with one last aggregate.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po drug dang ni gcig tu nges par mi ldan no //🔽'jug pa'i dngos po thams cad ni gcig tu nges par mi ldan no //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po drug dang ni gcig tu nges par mi ldan no // 'jug pa'i dngos po thams cad ni gcig tu nges par mi ldan no //
translated: He is certainly not endowed with six appropriated aggregates.🔽He is certainly not endowed with all the aggregates of engagement.

original: bar du gcod pa'i phung po thams cad dang yang gcig tu nges par mi ldan no //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i phung po thams cad dang yang gcig tu nges par mi ldan no //
translated: He is certainly not endowed with all the aggregates of obstruction.

original: phung po lhag ma rnams dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma rnams dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: It is not that he is endowed with the remaining aggregates, nor is it that he is not endowed with them.

original: 'di ni phung por gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phung por gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the presentation of the designation of the aggregates.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las phung po dang bcas pa'i sa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las phung po dang bcas pa'i sa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the stage with the aggregates from the Bodhisattvas’ Stage of Action in Accordance with Definitive Statements.

original: // / phung po med ba'i sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / phung po med ba'i sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage without the aggregates?

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold:

original: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the designation of the stage, the presentation of the designation of nirvana, and the presentation of the designation of synonyms for nirvana.

original: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the designation of the stage?

original: phung po med pa'i sa ni sa lnga po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phung po med pa'i sa ni sa lnga po 'di lta ste /
translated: The stage without the aggregates is the five stages, namely:

original: sems med pa'i si dang @282b bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa dang / nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyi cha re re gzhag pa bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems med pa'i si dang @282b bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sa dang / nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyi cha re re gzhag pa bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The stages of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas should be understood as being included in the stages of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the designation of nirvāṇa?

original: phung po med pa'i sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis po nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: phung po med pa'i sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis po nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The stage of the absence of the aggregates is presented as the two kinds of nirvāṇa: the nirvāṇa of peace and the nirvāṇa of no abiding.

original: nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nirvāṇa of peace?

original: des sngon phung po dang bcas pa'i sa la nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi rtogs shing thob la reg cing mngon sum du byas bas /
analyzed: des sngon phung po dang bcas pa'i sa la nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi rtogs shing thob la reg cing mngon sum du byas bas /
translated: It is the realization, attainment, contact, and actualization of the four kinds of peace on the stage that has the aggregates.

original: da ltar de'i phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la yang nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi po rnam grangs su 'gro ba'i nye bar zhi ba dang / phung po thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / phung po la brten pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang /
analyzed: da ltar de'i phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la yang nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi po rnam grangs su 'gro ba'i nye bar zhi ba dang / phung po thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / phung po la brten pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang /
translated: The expanse of nirvana in which there are no remaining aggregates is also classified in terms of four kinds of perfect peace: the peace of the cessation of the aggregates, the peace of the cessation of all the aggregates, the peace of the cessation of the suffering based on the aggregates and the peace of the cessation of the suffering based on the aggregates that is not subject to degeneration.

original: phung po la brten ba'i sdug bsngal skyer dogs pa nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: phung po la brten ba'i sdug bsngal skyer dogs pa nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: The expanse of nirvana in which the remainder of the aggregates does not exist is also the four kinds of pacification: the pacification of the categories, the pacification of all the aggregates, the pacification of the suffering that is based on the aggregates, and the pacification of the fear of suffering that is based on the aggregates.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: zhum ba med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: zhum ba med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: With a mind that is not discouraged,

original: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
analyzed: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
translated: one endures feelings.

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
translated: Like the going out of a lamp,

original: de yi sems ni rnam par grol //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par grol // zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: the mind is liberated.

original: 'di ni nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the nirvana of pacification.”

original: gnod pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is “the nirvana that is free of injury”?

original: phung po thams cad dang mi ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal 'jug pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa dang / gnas yongs su gyur pas bye ba dang / zag pa med pa'i dbyings gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phung po thams cad dang mi ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal 'jug pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa dang / gnas yongs su gyur pas bye ba dang / zag pa med pa'i dbyings gang yin pa ste /
translated: it is distinguished by the transformation of the basis, and it is the realm of the uncontaminated.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong bde ba la gnas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong bde ba la gnas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “The monk who abides in happiness is said to be in nirvana.”

original: yang ji skad du ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / yang dag par ma byung ba ni yod do //
analyzed: yang ji skad du ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / yang dag par ma byung ba ni yod do //
translated: Moreover, it is said: “The unborn, the unarisen, the uncreated, the uncompounded, and the absolutely unoriginated exist.

original: skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / byas pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / yang dag par 'byung ba ni yod do //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / byas pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / yang dag par 'byung ba ni yod do //
translated: The born, the arisen, the created, the compounded, and the absolutely originated exist.

original: gal te ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / yang dag par ma byung ba med du zin na /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / yang dag par ma byung ba med du zin na /
translated: If the unborn, the unarisen, the uncreated, the uncompounded, and the absolutely unoriginated did not exist,

original: skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / byas pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / yang dag par 'byung ba las nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes nga mi zer ba zhig na /🔽gang gi phyir ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / yang dag par ma byung ba de yod pas de'i phyir skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / byas pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / byas pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / yang dag par 'byung ba las nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes nga mi zer ba zhig na / gang gi phyir ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / yang dag par ma byung ba de yod pas de'i phyir skyes pa dang / byung ba dang / byas pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang /
translated: I do not say that there is deliverance from what is produced, what has come into existence, what is made, what is compounded, or what has originated.

original: yang dag par 'byung ba las nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes nga zer ro zhes gsungs @283a * //🔽pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'byung ba las nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes nga zer ro zhes gsungs @283a * // pa lta bu'o //
translated: But because there is what is not produced, not come into existence, not made, not compounded, and not originated, therefore I say that there is deliverance from what is produced, what has come into existence, what is made, what is compounded, and what has originated.🔽This is a case of the Blessed One’s intentional teachings.

original: zab cing rgya che la dpag tu med pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni grangs su gtogs pa med do zhes bya ba de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che la dpag tu med pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni grangs su gtogs pa med do zhes bya ba de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has also said, “Nirvāṇa is profound and vast, and cannot be enumerated.”

original: de la rtogs par dka' bas na zab po //
analyzed: de la rtogs par dka' bas na zab po //
translated: It is profound because it is difficult to understand.

original: yon tan dang ldan zhing spangs pas na rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan zhing spangs pas na rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast because it is endowed with good qualities and is free from faults.

original: zad mi shes pas na dpag tu med do //
analyzed: zad mi shes pas na dpag tu med do //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is inexhaustible.

original: grangs su gtogs pa med do zhes bya ba ni gnyis su bstan du med pa'i phyir grangs su gtogs pa med do //
analyzed: grangs su gtogs pa med do zhes bya ba ni gnyis su bstan du med pa'i phyir grangs su gtogs pa med do //
translated: It is not included in the categories because it cannot be demonstrated as a duality.

original: ji ltar grangs su gtogs pa med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar grangs su gtogs pa med ce na /
translated: How is it not included in the categories?

original: yod ce'am / med ces bstan du med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs sam /
analyzed: yod ce'am / med ces bstan du med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs sam /
translated: Because it cannot be demonstrated as existent or nonexistent,

original: gzugs las tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs las tha dad pa'am /
translated: as form or as different from form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: as feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or as different from consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas phye zhing gcig tu nges par dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas phye zhing gcig tu nges par dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the suchness of those, purified of the two obscurations, and it is the one definite, stainless sphere.

original: de ni gnod pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gnod pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the non-afflictive nirvana.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa la ni mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa la ni mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The designation of nirvana is established as the combination of those two.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /🔽de la mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs ni 'di rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na / de la mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs ni 'di rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: What is the presentation of the categories of nirvana?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood that the categories of nirvana are as follows:

original: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug pa dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / gnas dang / gling dang / skyob pa dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / bde ba dang / zhi ba dang / legs ba'i gzhi dang /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug pa dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / gnas dang / gling dang / skyob pa dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / bde ba dang / zhi ba dang / legs ba'i gzhi dang /
translated: Permanence, stability, steadfastness, immutability, a basis, an island, a shelter, a recourse, a friend, happiness, peace, a good foundation,

original: bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi gzhol ba dang / blta dka' ba dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / mya ngan med pa dang / 'chi 'pho med pa dang / rims nad med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi gzhol ba dang / blta dka' ba dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / mya ngan med pa dang / 'chi 'pho med pa dang / rims nad med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang /
translated: well-being, immobility, non-inclination, difficulty to see, immortality, non-sorrow, non-death, non-fever, non-affliction,

original: nad med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / spros pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nad med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / spros pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: non-disease, non-agitation, nirvana, and freedom from mental proliferation.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya ste /
translated: Such statements should be understood as synonyms for nirvana.

original: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the presentation of the designation of synonyms for nirvana.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las phung po med pa'i sa rdzogs tes mang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las phung po med pa'i sa rdzogs tes mang po rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the stage of no further learning, the tenth of the stages of the Yogacarya.

original: // /'di la shloka ni brgyad stong dgu brgya brgyad cu rtsa bzhi yod do /
analyzed: // /'di la shloka ni brgyad stong dgu brgya brgyad cu rtsa bzhi yod do /
translated: This has 8,984 ślokas.
